data.formatted_address: 81 Huyền Trân Công Chúa, Hoà Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: The Marble Mountains

reviews.text:
Had lots of good views. Had a good workout climbing in and out. Was very enjoyable but  it’s kind of work out and hot sunny day .sweat out.Overpriced marble souvenirs but the short hike was worth it.

Interesting place to go,
I’d choose a cooler day in hindsight but still well worth it.
I’d also recommend doing as part of a tour group as you’ll learn a lot more and they’re super cheap so there’s no reason not to.
Lots of steps and I though really not that bad if you struggle from the couch to fridge this isn’t a activity for you, but normal people should be fine just take water, though in saying that there  is vendors up the top as well and an elevator.
Make sure you go to the bottom are first “hell” as it very interesting natural cave
Cheers

Fascinating caves with carvings hewn from the stone inside. Beautiful view of the river from the top. Touristy at the entry way and very busy, but even busy, the caverns are grand enough to be enjoyed. For a fun challenge, walk up the staircase at the ticket counter rather than taking the elevator.  Buddhist temples were beautiful, and modernized with neon lights! Surprising. Easy to get around -- just buy a ticket. No tour guide needed.

Quite nice.
Leafy on top.
I really like the layers of history so some of the Buddha statues were newer than others.
A bit strange having an elevator tacked on to a historical site. But I guess I can understand them wanting to create access but not sure that would be preferred in other heritage places.
I wish I found it a bit weird the way they put LED lighting strips inside the biggest cave around the altars.
There are toilets on the top and you can buy coconuts to drink.
Overall quite nice.

Very beautiful and interesting piece of nature. We first went inside the cave thinking that is was the main tourist attraction of the mountain. However after going up the lift we soon can to realise it wasn’t. The steps can be very dangerous especially when it’s raining. Beware of the vendors at the bottom of the mountain, they will be waiting. One follow us for about 200 meters after we repeatedly told her we don’t have enough space. It is a nice place and I will recommend come here if you like the stair master. There are things to see if you do not like steps as well.

I had an amazing experience visiting Marble Mountain. The site is not only visually stunning but also rich in historical significance. The added value of having a knowledgeable tour guide cannot be overstated. They provided detailed insights into the history of why and how the mountain was built, as well as the types of stones used in its construction.

One fascinating aspect is the bullet holes in the stones of the walls, a stark reminder of the conflict between the Vietnamese people and the Americans, who were shooting at each other. Additionally, the holes in the cave at the top were created by bombs dropped by the Americans during the Vietnam War. This historical context added a deeper layer of appreciation for the site. Overall, Marble Mountain is a must-visit, combining natural beauty with a compelling historical narrative.

data.formatted_address: 24 Trần Phú, Thạch Thang, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Đà Nẵng Museum

reviews.text:
I wonder why this museum is not so popular among the tourists!? I hardly ever remember a single video blog in which this museum is mentioned!
But, you must visit it! It is the history of Da Nang! Particularly the second floor about modern history. Just imagine 15-20 years ago there was nothing in Son Tra! It's so interesting to watch "before and after" pictures!

There are many interesting stuffs about local  history, the theme of 2nd floor is Vietnam War era weapon and other miscs. 3rd floor is some minority tribe related exhibition.

Unfortunately, the maintenance is quite miserable, the building and collections are decaying, they even don't replace burned out light bulbs, around 20% bulbs here are dead, and the staffs don't bother to close windows when heavy raining, just let wooden floor soaking in rain and rotting. That's how miserable this museum is.

And there is no airconditions, only few old fans don't help much.

Do some maintenance works and hiring people has more passion in work to save your museum.

20K entrance fee.
Most parts are not airconditioned.
3 floors.
No interactivity or videos. Just text and items, so it's kinda boring.

This museum is a real find. My favourite site to visit in Da Nang. An antidote to the otherwise manic tourism-drenched ambience of the city.  So odd that it is not better known, publicized and visited. What would be great is if a very competent and passionate person can be recruited and given a budget to upgrade it to prevailing international standards. The first thing to do soon is to clarify up front that this is the precise location of the start of France’s invasion and misrule of what is now Vietnam. And perhaps to rescue the abandoned and weed infested cannons languishing outside the entrance, that were - I gather - used to return fire in 1858 by the defenders.

It has three floors and we were the only one visiting it, there was none there.
Probably the ground floor is a bit boring but the others display some interesting stuff, and some sad pictures of the war.
However, the lack of AC makes it extremely difficult to enjoy and  appreciate the museum, as it's extremely hot inside and you'll just want to rush and be done with it. Fans don't help at all.
I would recommend it only when they fix the AC (which there are in the ceilings,  they just don't work).

data.formatted_address: 26X9+F2G, Duy Tân, Hoà Cường Bắc, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Chi Minh Museum

reviews.text:
I read 30,000 VND though we ended up paying 60,000 VND per person. The ticket prices have gone up. It's still a part of a very much running regiment that has converted a few segments into a museum divided in 4 parts. Full of history - good collection of weapons but modern artillery as well as primitive handmade ones.
Just one feedback - the fans barely worked, no air conditioning, it gets really hot & humid. We weren't able to complete the visit due to the same. It was practically empty in July 2024 with no visitors but us.

Took my kids for a history lesson today. I’m also a history buff especially when it came to the Vietnam war. I was more excited than the kids. We biked there with no issues. The staff was friendly and told us where to park my bike. Admission was affordable. My youngest didn’t have to pay, yay! The tanks and planes outside was awesome. A lot of “war” time artifacts and exhibits which my oldest son digger. Also learned quite a bit about the history of Vietnam. Got to see a replica of Ho chi Ming’s last home. The garden and pond was serene and well kept. The newer building was a nice upgrade for the main museum was quite old. All in all a worth it experience for the family. I would recommend visiting, can easily spend half 3 hours here.

If you are in Da Nang and interested in knowing Vietnamese history then this is a must-visit place where an entry ticket is 60k VND. The museum is three stories and it requires at least two to three hours to explore it completely and peacefully.
Inside the premises, you can see many planes, machinery etc used during wartime.
Inside the main building, it was kind of confusing to locate the way as there were no arrow marks but none of the staff was there inside the museum.
There are many interesting facts I got to know but the sad part was the description was written everywhere mostly in Vietnamese and very few in English so it was difficult to co-relate.

60K entrance fee.
Includes the main museum with 3 floors. War vehicles are located outdoors. HCM history in another building with 1 floor. And HCM house.

No aircon. There are only fans where some are not even on, so it was hot.

The interactive buttons are not working.
Some do not have english translation.
Went through everything, and some parts still didn't really get the history.

All text and items, no videos, interactivity, so it was kinda boring.

I felt like there was lacking more of a background story, since it jumps straight into photos of exact events. Many artefacts from the war and very cool maps and war mock-ups. Building is old and dusty, but still standing. Coming from another ex-communist country i could definitley see the old communist touch in the designs.

data.name: Nhu Mother Monument

reviews.text: Roundabout with statue of a national heroine. Supposedly made from metal from weaponary leftover from the war.
Amazing monument of a heroic mother who contributed so much for Vietnamese army. The view is very great.
It was a monument at the centre of Danang. It was made from steel which was used in weapons of VN war. Her hand directed to the North of Vietnam
It was a monument at the centre of Danang. It was made from steel which was used in weapons of VN war. Her hand directed to the North of Vietnam.

data.formatted_address: 366C+72J, Kiệt 75 Nguyễn Văn Linh, Phước Ninh, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Da Nang Fresco Village

reviews.text:
This review is actually for the newly opened cafe along the fresco village route

Cafe Bich Hoa. Enjoy coffee and drinks in a pretty garden courtyard. Complete with a live rooster and eagle. The family is so kind and made us feel welcome at their home cafe. Please support local small businesses and drop by!
I love the pantings. There are not much left. Most of them are falling apart. But I love the tight street with all this pictures. I wish they care more.

I found this place accidentally while I was driving around the city after lunch, it was a bit hot. It’s in Son Tra, front of the beach but a bit far from My Khe and My An beach. This place is not big, walk around in 10 minutes maximum and you explore all here, no any fee or ticket. The paintings are very nice, all of them about the blue sea, beach, ocean, fishing, marine life,..
1 thing I don’t like here is trash, it’s in a small alley and it will be better without trash.

This place may have been a drop by place four or five years ago, but now should be taken out of Google map. I seriouly believe some reviews are fakes for some reason. Do not go there unless you want to see dirty alleys and old drawings on small walls

The winding alleys of this part of the city offer a chance to get momentarily lost and connect with the locals of Danang on a more personal level. If you're lucky, you might spot some intriguing street art. While not a headline attraction, it's a definite must-visit for street photographers looking to explore.

data.formatted_address: 47H5+VRV, Monkey Pass, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Sân bay trực thăng (Địa điểm lịch sử)

reviews.text: Worth going here for a top view of the city , nice angle to take some amazing pictures and during the day and I am sure night to , easy to get too if you drive nice walk too if you walk up there, its few minutes drive below to peak of Sontra mountain !
The road to the top of the Chessboard will pass by this old helipad.

The helipad is a historical place that can park 6 helicopters at the same time (according to the introduction). This area is currently a spacious, empty land, right next to the road to Son Tra to go to Ban Co peak. You can visit comfortably and easily read the captions.
Great place to see the sights of Daang.
Interesting

data.formatted_address: 36GC+HR5, Đ. Thành Điện Hải, Thạch Thang, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Dien Hai citadel relics

reviews.text: Cx dc
Great wall

Coming to Dien Hai citadel, in addition to admiring the beauty of the architecture, visitors can also admire hundreds of years old cannons. Including the cannon discovered in 2008 with a length of 2.8m, a head diameter of 23cm and a tail of 42cm.

Cannons made of bronze, cast iron or iron could weigh up to 3 tons. To date, although most of the guns have rusted, the gun body is still intact.

The ruins are being preserved quite well even though they are surrounded by large buildings. The location is next to the Da Nang City administrative building, but the entrance is small and hidden if you don't pay much attention. Luckily, the City has arranged signage.

Museum or Relic of Dien Hai Citadel right in the administrative center of Da Nang. Go straight to Thanh Dien Hai street, go straight to the museum and park on the right, not according to the sign, which is on Ly Tu Trong street. The museum is open every day of the week from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Currently, admission is free until December 31, 2022. The space outside the museum is very green, the fresh air is very pleasant, it is cool and fun to sit here and play. The museum has documents and artifacts related to Da Nang history. Inside the museum there are 3 floors, the 1st floor is a display showing the natural and social history of Da Nang, the 2nd floor is a display related to Da Nang history. history of revolutionary struggles and war evidence, the 3rd floor is the culture of ethnic groups in Da Nang and Quang Nam. Each exhibit has a QR code for you to scan and listen to the explanation. From January 1, 2023, the museum will charge a fee, and there will also be a tour guide for groups of 5 people if needed. Actually, even though I am a resident of Da Nang, I still don't fully understand. Next time will ask the tour guide. Here, taking virtual photos is also very beautiful. You can both see history and have a place to take photos. In the cool afternoon, inviting friends to sit and play in front is also very enjoyable.

data.formatted_address: Thôn An Sơn, Hòa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Ba Na Hills

reviews.text: Its a fantasy park. A lot and lot to walk. Like any other amusement parks the ticket price is high. Very well maintained and courteous staff in the whole place. Food is very reasonably priced. What ever souvenirs all are responsibly priced. Lots of shows and food stalls all around the park. Its crowded on all days but still the crowd is managed very well by the staff.

What a wonderful place. It's heaven on earth, so beautifully build and managed by the people working there. I was most amazed with food they offered, on the top of the hill far away from India, got to eat India food and OH MY GOD, it was fantastic. Only thing was it was too crowded and couldn't take a single picture (without people in it). The view is fantastic from up there and if you are lucky to visit it when it's less crowded it will be awesome.

Make sure you have good footwear as there is a lot of walking. And if you don't like crowds, you're best to get there early. Apparently, they average 20.000 people a day. The ride up in the gondola was awesome, i was told once again that early morning is the best time as it's clear, and you can see for miles. The bridge is awesome. That's what I wanted to see. There is construction work going on up there, but that does not interfere with enjoying your day. So much to see and do

This place is amazing.
It is so beautiful and cool. Since your in the hill temperature is pleasant.
Kid friendly rides.
The buffet was really good with such a wide range of food.
But the regular street food there is perfect especially the German dishes and Azerbaijan Cafe.
The prices are regular unlike other. Theme parks in other countries. So no over. Inflated food and drink.
100% worth the visit or 2

Highly recommend to stay a night here if you want to fully enjoy this entire place. A day trip is not enough especially when you will get caught with the peak hours where a lot of other tourists travel at the same time.

Do take note that the accommodation here is not cheap at all.

The hand is not worth the hype by the way. You can't even fly a drone here even though you might see a lot of beautiful photos here taken by drone.

data.formatted_address: 2736+WM6, Hòn Thủy Sơn, Hoà Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Huyen Khong Cave

reviews.text: Explore the rich cultural heritage! Each step reveals stories of resilience, innovation, and enduring beauty worth celebrating and cherishing.

The biggest and the most beautiful cave in the marble mountains. It's a place where peace, bliss and tranquility is experienced in tandem. The sun's ray peaking through the openings in the cave and the temples with its fragrance and lighting is simply beautiful! It's a bit of a walk but it's totally worth it

This cave is one of several caves situated at the marble mountain in Da Nang. This is the largest known cave passage in Vietnam.
It's a bit mysterious and dark at some places but it's a short walk from one to the others.

This should be in your itinerary if you are staying in Da Nang as it's actually very close to city center.

This cave is situated at the marble mountain in Da Nang. This is the largest known cave passage in vietnam.
This place is mesmerising and I couldn’t take my eyes of it. Statue of Buddha was just alluring.
This should be in your itinerary if you are staying in Da Nang.
The most beautiful cave in the complex. Must be even more beautiful in the sunny weather

reviews.text: It's here and it's real!
It’s tricky to find, but don’t give up. It’s there!
Hard to find but you will get an impressive view over Da Nang
So close to the road but so hard to find. Only a few feet in. Right behind power pole 74.
famous landmark to American soldiers during the war.  difficult to find.  right behind powerpost 74.

data.formatted_address: 29 Cầu Rồng, An Hải Trung, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Dragon Bridge

reviews.text: It is pretty cool looking and something you can't miss when you come to Da Nang.  My only disappointment was I wanted to see the dragon breathe fire, but for some unknown reason on the night I went to see it, Saturday July 20th, it didn't.

Great weekend spot to watch people and also view the 9pm show that the dragon does. If you want to get drenched in water , go on the bridge where the dragon spits fire.
Important to keep an eye on your belongings here.

we went to this. But viewed it from the yacht restaurant.
It was good to see. Only on Saturday and Sundays. The bridge was absolutely packed. 9pm sharp and goes.for maybe 5 mins. fire and then water..so if you're on the bridge you get wet.🤣

Definitely a cool bridge but the whole flame thing is incredibly overhyped, crowded and dangerous. Thousands of people converge in the market then cram into the area near the bridge. The vendors in the area seem to own the space so if you sit in the chairs you need to buy something from them. I don’t mind that but then some older woman with an absolute wad of cash was walking around yelling and collecting more money from people. No idea what that was about. So there we are waiting for the flames and they’re they are a few short blasts over a couple minutes then huge jets of water. Not sure why this is even a thing. Meanwhile, pickpockets are everywhere, with numerous stories of people getting wallets, phones and passports stolen. What a nightmare this was. Avoid like the plague m.

It's a beautiful bridge. Well designed.
The little show was amusing. Nothing special but the dragon will spit Fire and Water for about 3 min.
If you are in Danang on the week end, go see it.
It's free and it start at 9pm Fridays and weekend.

data.formatted_address: 48FJ+2MG Bán đảo, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Cây Đa Ngàn Năm

reviews.text:
No entry allowed. Guard told me the government closed it but pretty sure the big Resort has something to do with it. Such a shame big Resorts have the power to do such things.

When asking them if the Resort guests have access they were reluctant to answer. And say it is private property, so I first have to book a room.

Still definitely worth visiting the rest of the island, super nice drive :)

“We cannot get out : we cannot get out.
They have taken the bridge and the second hall”

As Gandalf read from the book of Marzabul, so too does this apply to this location. They have blocked the access road further up so general public cannot access this area. There is a sign stating it is a landslide area near the junction at the top.

We have totally calories burnt 🥵
Firstly, you have to pass through Son Tra Intercon after that ride further in to the small road on the right and going straight up. Please be cautious the road is rather stiff up by 17° gradient constantly about 1km, so it will be rather dangerous by going up and down hill for sure so that's riding skill and endurance is challenging to your maximum.
Nevertheless, you'll be rewarded by the amazing natural scene of Bayan heritage tree which existence with 800 years old, it's really worth to go once even though it's tough.
God blessed I still capable to take this challenge and experience it.
Tips:
1. Going up by zigzag riding.
2. Lower your saddle before going down hill.
3. Winter is the best time to visit.
4. More training before challenge it.

In Đà Nẵng, there's a tree,
Cây Đa Ngàn Năm, so tall and free.
A thousand years it's stood in glee,
A leafy giant for all to see!

A marvel, yes, a sight to share,
With stories hidden in its air.
So on your map, please do declare,
“This tree's a wonder, beyond compare!”
Grand old tree. The place is accessible by 7 seater cars, but keep in mind that the road is steep and narrow, you can only turn back at the end of it. Drive carefully!

data.formatted_address: 18 Hùng Vương, Hải Châu 1, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Da Nang Visitor Center

reviews.text: I found the service to be excellent, always enthusiastic and quick to support customers. I have visited Da Nang many times and found the staff to be very helpful in every way and extremely polite. Through this, I was able to choose very suitable and impressive destinations, and I fell in love with Da Nang because of the lovely people at this center
The place is beautiful with enthusiastic consulting staff, I got all of my questions answered clearly, very satisfied. I would recommend to come here for support.

Just wrapping up my incredible trip to Da Nang, and I wanted to give a huge shoutout to the Da Nang Visitor Center!

The staff there were fantastic - friendly, spoke perfect English, and most importantly, incredibly helpful.  I had a million questions (where's the best banh mi?  How do I get to Marble Mountain?), and they patiently answered every single one, even whipping out a map and circling must-see spots.  They even gave me a handy brochure with day trip recommendations that perfectly matched what I was looking for.

Thanks to their advice, I ended up having the most amazing time in Da Nang.  The beaches were pristine, the food was incredible (seriously, that bun cha!), and I even managed to squeeze in a day trip to Hoi An.  None of it would have been possible without the fantastic folks at the Visitor Center.

So, if you're an adventurer from Down Under (or anywhere else for that matter) planning a trip to Da Nang, make sure the Visitor Center is your first stop.  They'll set you on the right track for an unforgettable Vietnamese adventure!

After we read some bad opinions about Hoi An visitor centre we decided to visit Da Nang visitor centre. We had a lot of questions about Tet holiday, buses, trains, National parks, other cities. Since a lot of places we asked a out where located in other provinces they had to call every place and ask. They were super helpful. Super nice and super friendly. They also speak good English. Even offered us a delicious snack while we where waiting. Thank you for help!!

I stumbled upon this visitor center not needing assistance on any tour or local location but needing help on my local phone which i got the sim at the airport upon arrival. Ms. Trinh was very patient and actually helped me with the problem and got it resolved without going to a mobile or tech store. She has great command of the english language and is a great asset to this visitor center.

data.formatted_address: Hoàng Sa, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Dong Dinh Art Museum

reviews.text:
It’s a pity to see recent negative comments as we had a great visit here last weekend. it might not be a great option for short term tourists who is looking for a "real" museum experience.

We’re local family with kids and kids love it here. walking around different paths to explore the forest, checking different kinds of fish in the ponds, climbing big rocks, lying on the hammocks, playings with flowers and trees… the trees keep it cool and comfortable despite the hot weather. great view over the ocean and Danang city.

It's not really a museum so don't set high expectation regarding that.

In my opinion it's not a very good museum. There are 2 or 3 huts you can see with some pottery artefacts and some fishing equipment. The infrastructure seems to be breaking down and the information signs are badly translated. If you have time go have a look and build your own opinion but if you don't have much time it's a place to skip.

60k for a coffee, really? The most expensive in Vietnam.
Regarding the “museum”, I think they don’t know what that means. The view is nice though.

30k dong for the entrance fee and 75k dong to include coffee.
It might be good place tonhave coffee at sunset time but nothing too much. Only a small number of old hut and houses.

After a long walk around the Linh Pagoda on the mountain, our driver drove us part way down the mountainside and stopped near a gate where a guy was selling tickets. Our nephew purchased tickets for our group and led the way up a rocky, unpacked mountain path.

Soon we realised that this was a historical site of mountain dwellers who kept to themselves, pillaged the forest and surroundings, built their own houses and lived a rather free lifestyle with no one to bother them.  Lovely brooks running through the few houses which remain, bicycles, earthenware, some clothing, precious to the dwellers - preserved for history.
Worth a good walk around if you are interested in history.

data.formatted_address: Unnamed Road, 25Q3+8C9, Hoà Khánh Nam, Liên Chiểu, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Camp Reasoner

reviews.text: went here a week ago, our taxi driver asked a few workman and didnt give up until he found it for us. It was hard to find and now sits on the edge of a cliff in the stone quarry. it wouldnt surprise me if we are the last people to see this, its behind a fence, covered by foliage and 2m from a sheer drop into the stone quarry. The pictures show land behind it, thats all now gone.Glad we found it.
I guess I'm the last one here
Very good

data.formatted_address: Đ. 2 Tháng 9, Hoà Cường Bắc, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: DA NANG DOWNTOWN

reviews.text: We brought our kids after dinner around night time to visit. Not a lot of people there due to the weather I’m guessing. The Ferris wheel was worth the money even though it was a little pricey. I wouldn’t really eat inside due to the price and other options just 5 minutes away. A lot of the rides were closed but it was nice to walk around. Enjoyed the different continent exhibits. The park was really big so we took our time. All in all it was just OK and some parts felt like a tourist trap.

For some reason the couple is not popular, so there are very few people there, which was a plus for us. There are not many attractions and for me, as a person who has visited many extreme attractions, these were not scary, but just fun! The  Sun wheel is simply huge and offers a wonderful view of the city! We had a good time, but it was very hot until the evening came, and there was no way to cool off anywhere except the toilets

Giving 3 stars only just for the fact that we were not advised that the rides would close by 9pm instead of 10pm as the tickets said.
Felt like being in a private park which was nice but we missed 3 of the rides I really wanted to do because we were attending the show at the front .
Only the Wheel is was open till nearly closing time suggestion would be to do the Sun Wheel only at the end so you have plenty of time to do all the rides and watch the show.
Tickets were purchased via Klook App.

Small theme park. I would not waste too much time here because when we went there there was nobody. It is nice to have the park to yourself but it also takes away a bit of fun. If you do not have much time, I would skip this and only go to Ba Na Hills which are far more better and bigger. Also a few rides where closed. If you plan to go do that in the evening when everything has more light and is more nice to see. A few hours should be more than enough to do everything at least a few times.

Danang's amusement parks offer fun-filled experiences for visitors of all ages. From thrilling rides to entertaining shows and delicious food options, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

I recommend visiting during weekdays to avoid crowds and long wait times. Be sure to check the park's schedule for special events or performances to enhance your experience.

Don't forget to stay hydrated and wear comfortable clothing and shoes for a full day of excitement.

Overall, Danang's amusement parks provide a fantastic opportunity to create lasting memories with friends and family while exploring the city's vibrant entertainment offerings.

data.formatted_address: Hòa Ninh, Hòa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Ba Na Hills SunWorld

reviews.text: Ba Na Hills was such a fun place to explore and trying different food. I would definitely suggest buying ticket in advance and staying overnight for one nightly at least if you want to have the full experience. By staying overnight, guests that stay overnight get access to the Hand Bridge early access the following morning at 6am for the best pictures before Ba Na Hills officially open for everyone else at 7. But also for staying overnight, exploring at night allows you to take some of the best pictures. Definitely come here at least once if you haven’t yet❗️❗️❗️

A good half day out with my husband at this theme park which has the iconic golden bridge. The cable car and the views were the highlight of the theme park, as it’s nestled on the side of the mountain there’s 360 panoramic views. I’d recommend to people going straight to the golden bridge as early as possible because it was super crowded at 11am. The whole theme park is situated on a few different plots so you need to take either the mini train, cable car or funicular car around. There’s a lot to see but not heaps to do. Most of the rides are free in the arcade area but the better mini rides like the toboggan cost 70.000 VND per person. Overall a fun day out!

Mind blowing place, absolutely amazing! Stunning views! It's hard to express by words or even by photos, you simply need to take a backpack and go, no matter what. It's sooo large area that even the whole day is not enough. Better to go very early in the morning to have a less people on the bridge and make the best photos. Apart from that, just enjoy the time and have fun. I would not recommend a guided tours to avoid waiting of the crowd, just go yourself as transportation is available. These us a plenty of places with nice food and beverages, and a lot of other fun things to do. The amusement park is closing at 17.00 so better to have fun before closing.

Visited Ba Na Hill/Golden Bridge as a part of our private tour with Wide Eyed tour. From 8 cable car routes, beautiful flower garden, many restaurants in French village to Golden Bridge, the whole complex is very well set up.

The flower garden is absolutely beautiful, one of the best gardens I have seen, the Golden Bridge is very unique and stunning, two gigantic hands symbolizes a mystery of nature as God is carrying the gift from the ground. However we were seriously impressed by the cable car. It was first open in 2013, now has 8 cable car routes, it is about 5.7 meters long and is the longest cable car in the world, the ride to the top of the mountain takes only 20 minutes considering the mountain stands at the altitude of 1,487m above sea level.

The whole complex is very well managed, very clean with many park attendants, it runs like clockwork.

However it is very crowded, everyday around 3000 tourists will visit this place, make sure you get there early in the morning then leave after lunch around 1pm, it often rains in the afternoon and usually has a very long queue for cable car going down the mountain, not to mention Cable Car operation will be suspended if there is heavy storm.

Beautiful place. Lots and lots of walking to do . Like any other fantasy oarks the price of tickets are more. Better to go on a weekday. Weekends are very crowded. Many shows and movies happening all around the park . Well maintained and very well organised. Well maintained too. Crowd management is done very nicely by the management

data.formatted_address: XXWQ+VGJ, Hoà Phú, Hòa Vang, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Fantasy Park

reviews.text: Awesome place. Must watch during your trip. Try to reach as early as possible as there are so many things to see. Specially for kids, Plz Park couple of hours for fun park where awesome games are there. The complete exp is just amazing. The place is totally different in evening as well.

Is an experience cable car was amazing . The views and scenery are breathtaking. The amusement park side not so great ok for younger children. Didn't like they still wanted to charge for certain attractions even tho paid quite a lot to get into the place.
It's a must. The chairlift ride was great. Huge park with lots of attractions. Our favourite was obviously the Golden Hand Bridge. The gardens were impressive. Fantastic experience
Nice cooling place. A good 5hrs is well spent on Ba Na Hills. Would be good to reach there by 9am. There a nice international buffet in hill top at Fantasy Park.

We found Sun World Fantasy Park is the best place to visit in Da nang. Specially well decorated, fantastic environment, all rides are free and the indian restaurant Bharata's food is awesome, delicious. I had our lunch there it was included in our tour package. Ohh food, I never had as much as food during the lunch .. Must try.

data.formatted_address: Số 02 Đ. 2 Tháng 9, Bình Hiên, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Da Nang Museum of Cham Sculpture

reviews.text:
It is really a great education and discovery place. The collection is extensive and the display is nicely done. There is a virtual commentary provided through scanning of the QR code. It is a great assistance as you walk and appreciate the different statues and sections of the museum.
It was a little hot as the AC was not working but many fans were strategically placed to keep the place well-ventilated and cooling for visitors. The garden do need work to complete the lovely place
Small museum but wonderful artifacts representing the local Vietnam culture.  Definitely worth visiting for an hour or two.

Beautiful Champa sculptures,most of them are from ancient Hinduism temples.
It's a small size museum, you can finish the tour here around 1 hour.

Airconditions here are not enough, too hot and humid in summertime, especially the front part of museum.

There seems no souvenir shop here.
In addition to sculpture, the museum also offers insights into traditional handicrafts and generally provides a good overview of Cham relics throughout Vietnam and neighbouring countries.
Fascinating sculptures and history. You're pretty much on your own unless a guide brings you, but there are English translations on most of the sculptures.

data.formatted_address: Đ. Trần Hưng Đạo, An Hải, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: CauTinhYeu

reviews.text: Nice view of river and golden dragon bridge fires up Saturday and Sunday nites 9pm great attraction don't get too close you'll get wet
Nice views of the river. And if you want to see the Fire and Water breathing dragon come at least 1hr before start. Starts at 9pm local time.
Very very good experience at night time, particularly elevated if you are with someone you love romantically.  A bit too far from the dragon bridge, but still close enough to get a faraway show!

Lovely bridge with lots of locks showing all the couples that came here to strongly lock in their relationship. Bridge is not that big just roughly 20-30m long, but is pretty enough for some pictures.

A picture spot by the dragon bridge. It seems like this place is for couples who want to have a long term relationships as they use a heart shaped lock to lock up their future. That’s probably why this bridge is called love bridge.

data.formatted_address: 78 Đ. Lê Duẩn, Thạch Thang, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Danang Fine Arts Museum

reviews.text: A wide variety of paintings and sculptures from old, modern, and contemporary times fill three levels of this well-organized museum. Works have labels in English as well as Vietnamese. The collection is large enough to offer much to see, but isn't so big as to be overwhelming. The lower level is dedicated to visiting shows, currently with the theme New Year of the Dragon 2024. Admission is just 20,000 dong.
It doesn’t have much things but you can see some of great pictures and sculptures. The entrance ticket is very cheap so you can visit in day if you dont have any plan.

You can see lots of Vietnamese art here in different styles for a very reasonable price. The gallery is well air-conditioned and we were the only ones in there when we went. Worth a stop for a sight-seeing day in Da Nang

The ticket costed 20 vnd for adults and kids are able to visit exhibitions for free. For this price you can see three floors of vietnamese fine art. There is nothing like these art pieces in Europe! Visual styles, techniques and themes of the art is much different from what I used to see in European art. Totally worth to visit!
A hidden gem. Lovely collection of local arts & craft, including lacquer paintings.  Friendly staff and air conditioned venue.

data.formatted_address: 4 Trần Quốc Toản, Hải Châu 1, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Da Nang Food Tour

reviews.text: What a night we had with Anh on our Food Tour. The way he explained the food we ate, the history of Vietnam and tailored the experience to our group was fabulous. We would do the tour again in a heart beat. We've been on many food tours whilst travelling- and we could not fault this at all. Anh then gave us many recommendations for whilst in Da Nang that have all been incredible. He has made our trip here so enjoyable.

Best food tour we have been on so far. Anh knows so much about Vietnamese history and has a real interest in different cultures - we had so much to discuss. All the food was excellent (as were the book and show recommendations we discussed). It felt like the best night out with a fun friend. I want to do it all again!

This was an amazing tour! Anh was a great guide and was incredibly knowledgeable about the food, culture, and history of Da Nang and Vietnam. We went to five different local spots which I would have never found on my own and each one was great. This is much more than a food tour and I highly recommend!

Me and my brother hung out with Anh as he took us round all the local spots, giving great backstory and insights into the delicious food.

You really got the feeling you were off the tourist trail and experienced local cuisine and culture.

Anh was awesome, spoke better english than i did and the 3 of us went for beers after the tour at one of his favourite brewery bars, that we would never have found.

Would highly recommend if you are keen to experience some local culture and cuisine with great company.

Anh was a truly excellent host who went the extra mile throughout for me and my brother.

He tailored the tour to our needs perfectly and showed us through the best spots in town.

Highly recommended for anyone keen to see the real Da Nang and sample excellent food (and Drink).

Anh was truly amazing a host.

data.formatted_address: Bà Nà, Hòa Vang, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Ba Na Hills Center

reviews.text: In January the weather is super cold its better to wear jacket properly. Everything was very instagram-able worth it every penny ❤
A Must Visit place. The cable car structure is beautiful.
This is a magical place, do go early before the crowds when the bridge and park are far emptier and you can take beautiful photos and enjoy the surroundings
Very fun cool place to visit 😎 gondola rides and amazing castles up in the hills above the clouds sometimes

It's a very interesting place! We went in early January and it was cloudy and very cold at the top! Advice: wear warm clothes if you are going in rainy season. The weather at ground level is warm enough for shorts and tshirt or a dress but when you get to the top it's chilly!
Not at all what we were expecting either....the hand bridge is only 50m long. Good for photo opportunities but we thought it was a long walk along the bridge. The theme park at the very top is great to walk around if you are dressed properly for it. We saw lots of chilly people as it is so much colder up there than on the ground...us included!
Quite a few places were not open in the village at the top in January as it is classed as low season. I can imagine it would be mega busy in the warmer months with no cloud.

reviews.text: So beautiful. There's nothing like camping. Here you can park your motorbike for 15k and walk down a bit

Da Den Beach is ancient, but what idiots invented the name Yen Ngua beach like that, to attract views? And the entrance is also blocked right at the military station. On the way to the top of the chess board, trying to cross the fence is a violation, guys.
There is no way up, the road is still being repaired
Pretty . You can camp here

Road blocked every day from the turnoff at Yet Kieu through here
Currently, this tourist destination is no longer allowed
Don't waste your time, everyone

data.name: 3D Museum Art in paradise Da Nang

reviews.text:
My daughter has a great time here and we took lots of memorable pictures.

It's super fun and great way of great photos.

Great place to escape for 1-2 hours , we paid 200 k VND adults and my kids were under 130cm so they paid 100k VND , after the experience there is a small coffee shop to grab some refreshments. Well worth it and we all snapped away hundred of photos . Very enjoyable !! Recommend

I can not even describe it!!  Not even the photos are enough proof of our amazing experience!!  It was totally incredible! Most of the artwork are paintings on the walls & floors to give a 3D effect!!!   Not only a must-see if you visit  Danang, but also if you are visiting Viëtnam!

I definitely recommend this museum ! Creative, fun, lots of paintings and many different style. Expensive for local (200K), nice when not crowded, need time (2 to 3h to see everything if you want to take pictures). I suggest to eat before you go so that you might not be tired in the middle, since it can be intense. I had lots of fun there.
Good fun but looking a bit dated needs a little tlc to some of the art but ok for a wee visit.

reviews.text: It’s a nice calm summer breeze vibe outdoors

Through this street, it really looks like the West. In the evening, walking, walking on the beach, breathing fresh air and walking on An Thuong walking streets is very interesting. It's like traveling to the West, immersing yourself in the dynamic, agile and relaxing atmosphere!
Come here to experience it once, it's great

Some people collect bicycle tolls illegally.
Is this government policy?
I can't freely go to my favorite stores.
Newly opened walking street, full of Da Nang specialties.

data.name: Da Nang

data.formatted_address: Lương Hữu Khánh, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Tinh Vien Son Tra

reviews.text: The Bamboo garden is a beautiful, natural space to visit as you hike up the Son Tra mountain. There í are stream, small waterfalls, a pond, footpaths and bamboo and other trees and plants.  There are also many places to sit and their are beverages sold at the entrance. The garden is free to visit.  After you visit the garden you can continue to hike up the mountain to see the views of Da Nang, monkeys, birds, butterflies and many flowers and trees.

This beautiful hidden place is perfect for escaping traffic and enjoying the calmness of the woods. The garden is small but well done, with a variety of bamboo labeled and an excellent pond containing huge goldfish, other fish, and a lazy turtle. It's an ideal spot to spend a relaxing afternoon in the shade. Despite its peaceful atmosphere, the garden is not usually busy and offers plenty of shade.

It’s worth it visiting, location is good (just a little bit off road of the way to the famous  pagoda Linh Ung Pagoda)
Quite and peaceful, beautiful fish pond and the small original Vietnamese bamboo around

The Sơn Trà Bamboo Conservation Area is a great place to learn about bamboo. It is home to over 100 varieties of bamboo, collected by the monk Thích Thế Tường.

You can wander through the shady paths, admiring the towering bamboo stalks and listening to the gentle rustle of the leaves and the murmur of water.

It is a great place to relax and escape the hustle and bustle of city life. However, this is also where the monk lives, so please:
1. Keep quiet.
2. Dress modestly.
3. Do not throw any rubbish.

I even saw a man dipping his whole foot into the koi fish pond, has he no shame? And some used drink bottles were hung onto the bamboo or left in the stream. Homo sapiens, please behave well!

This beautiful place is perfect for escaping the city's hustle and bustle. Whether you're indulging in sweet idleness, contemplation, relaxation, or simply feeding the fish, it's a serene retreat. Just don't forget your insect repellent!

data.name: Phước Mỹ Beach

reviews.text: Long beach which is about a 15 min walk from our hotel. Sand is fine and waves is a bit strong. No swimming allowed. We came on early February so the water temperature is enough to keep you shivering. Nice place to relax while viewing the waves

most beautiful beach i’ve visited in vietnam. Clean, refreshing clear water, lovely view of the mountains. nice to walk along the beach in the early morning or evening. They have chairs with umbrellas to rent along the beach for 40k.

nice beach, you can cheaply rent sunbeds for the whole day, buy drinks and snacks. Lots of space for relaxation and swimming. After swimming you can change in the locker room and wash off the salt water

This was the first beach we visited when we came to Da Nang.
It's a big beach. A wide strip of sand.
At 7am on Sunday morning there were a lot of people. Morning is the best time to swim in the sea.
We liked the beach. Near the beach there is a paid shower to wash off the sea salt.
Calm beach with full peace !! Full of cleanliness, no crowd and police were everywhere to instruct not to go beyond the marked level on the beach! Good Food shops and Very good place to relax

data.formatted_address: 43J3+V3, Hòa Bắc, Hòa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn Nho Thung Lũng Nam Yên

reviews.text: Great place for the weekend! Amazing nature, clean and cozy bungalows, friendly and welcoming staff. Definitely recommend
A good place to spend your weekend.

I have been to this place many times but still love it and still want to go again. The space here is very chill, next to the river and close to the mountain, the landscape here is very beautiful, especially the large vineyard with nearly 2000 clusters growing close together, I really like it. In Da Nang, this is the only place that grows grapes. The owner is very good at taking care of grapes and flower plants, he plays guitar music all the time, he is very friendly and enthusiastic, the buffet here is very delicious, the quality of the food is cooked in a rustic style that I really like. , the staff here are attentive, the food is delicious, it's worth coming to experience and come back a second time. Love everything about this place.
Peaceful space, very worth experiencing. This time only the couple went, next time we will go with the whole family.
Food and sleeping accommodation are quite good. Fresh landscape. There should be road signs to make it easy to find because the entrance is quite small and difficult to find.

data.formatted_address: 478F+98W, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: The Monkey Mountain

reviews.text: Hiked up the mountain for three hours. It was a very steep climb on a paved road, and I was definitely out of breath even though I’m in good shape, I was hoping to find the red shanked monkeys on the way, but I did not see them. I did see the regular variety. The view at the top was amazing even though it was a little smoky due to burn season. The hike down took two hours, and it was all worth it .

Great run & lovely country side but you need a semi Auto or full manual bike, which are all available at Da Nang Motorcycle at 80 Ho Xuan Huong Dong at very reasonable prices & you get a sold helmet with the hire at no charge
Nice temple, lots of places to walk and sightsee in the area. As you travel around on the roads just avoid feeding the monkeys

𝐀𝐦𝐚𝐳𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐞𝐬/𝐜𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐬
There are beautiful caves with religious statues. Every nook and cranny is gorgeous.
Because of the location, it is surprisingly cool (still warm, but not as hot as in the city). There are vendors for food and drinks if you need it.
If you have a low tolerance for exercise, don't bother going.
My most favorite natural forests to visit.

data.formatted_address: V7MC+62F, Nhơn Lý, Thành phố Qui Nhơn, Bình Định, Vietnam
data.name: FLC Safari Zoo Quy Nhon

reviews.text: Nice zoo built to expand.  However, with not enough patrons, the upkeep is a bit lacking. Don’t pay for the additional electric cab ride unless you have difficulty with mobility.  The walks are short.

Very big zoo. The compounds for the various animals are very big, giving the animals plenty of room to wander. You can be lazy and get a mini bus aaround, but the walk is very easy and you can see more. There a a couple of refreshment stops around the park selling much needed drinks and ice creams. The ducks and swans looked a bit uninteresting at first.  As we approached there were 3 swans over the other side of the lake,and by the time they swam over to us, there was about 30.

Unnecessary chaos. Animal welfare aside (and there are some really deplorable animal enclosures here), the guest experience was awful on a holiday weekend visit. Only one ticket booth open to buy tickets with no line control, just pushing and shoving to get to the front. The buggy service is where it gets annoying and dangerous. BEWARE: if you don't get back on a buggy by the elephant, you won't be able to get on. So you're left waiting or walking. We wasted 30 minutes hoping that someone would have the decency to send some empty buggies to the swan lake where a load of kids and old people were waiting. We called the hotline many times, but the buggies just came full and nobody wanted to get off because Vietnamese people are smart and realize if they get off, there's no getting back on. FLC should be ashamed of itself for advertising a world class park, and delivering a third world experience. This can be easily fixed with better staff training, queues, and obviously more buggies.

Bottom Line: if you go on a regular day, it's probably okay, but still a pretty sad place to see animals. If you go on a busy day, you're in for a hellish experience. Be prepared to sweat and battle your way through...

100k per person, plus additional 70k for electric car transportation for full tour, but after drop is off at the first point of visit, they left and we have to wait for about 30mins to have the next pickup, while they said at the ticket station that they will have the car every 10mins. Many other people also upset about the services

This Zoo is not walkable when it is hot outside. Also strollers can not be ridden in the zoo due to special pavement type (grass paver). You should definitely buy the shuttle ticket in advance, because it is cheaper and the ticketing office is the only place where they have the shuttle tickets. This location is not the world class zoo but it is still good enough to hang out with family/friends.

data.formatted_address: 42 Lương Ngọc Quyến, Thuận Phước, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Dong Da Market

reviews.text: trusted place to buy seafoods in the afternoon 😂 they have a lot! especially big squid, crab, clams and similar ones. the price is reasonable.
Great place to buy fresh food, you get some live seafood here, and there's a foodcourt inside too

Very fresh live seafood! We bought some back to the Airbnb as midnight snack!

We also ate at the food stalls with some high quality food! 2 thumbs up!

Freshly deep fried durian outside of the covered market is to die for!

A gentleman serves the most genuine Bún bò Huế right outside of the market! His soup has the signature anis and cinnamon flavours, raw sliced beef is poached for only 2 seconds before the soup (for poaching) and the beef is placed in the already warm bun! Can’t believe it’s only 25.000 VND! Highly recommended!
Small market, nothing special, looks like more fabric and fashion dresses for local women, shoes, fruits & vegetables, the usual.
This is the market near my place so it's very convenient for me to go and shop here. Maybe just for a10-15 mins walk. Vendors and very nice and welcoming.

data.formatted_address: Mai Hắc Đế, An Hải Trung, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Son Tra Night Market

reviews.text:
Great place to find souvenirs and eat seafood! We had lobsters here for dinner and payment with credit card is possible. Sellers are also welcoming and very friendly

The food was very tasty and there are many stalls there that offer similar menu. Just choose which one you like. Tables and chairs are compact/tiny so be mindful of that.

It could get crowded so please plan your trip here. We had trouble getting grab car out from here (due to fireworks festival).

Fun place to walk around and watch people. Can get crowded. 30 min foot massages are advertised at 120K but most will accept 100K. Lots of food. Clothes, toys, luggage bags, fake Crocs, watches... etc.

Wow! What a fun experience! Sensory overload in all sorts of ways!! The coconut smoothies were fabulous! Good prices and you can barter in some things. Fun place to wander for an hour or two. There were covered stalls when it started raining it was still fairly dry.

Interesting place. Everyone is hustling to get your business. Food choices are pretty good but mainly meat and fish. Shops are full of fakes and you can barter the price down on everything. Good warm up for the dragon bridge (best done on weekend for fire/water breathing)

This is a must do.
It's fabulous. Must eat here. We had everything except for seafood. Only because we didn't feel like it.
We went on a Friday night. Wasn't to busy around 6.30,left at 8.30 was really busy. You can see the dragon bridge from there,but we will go back and see the show.

data.name: Bac My An Market

reviews.text:
They have lots of food in here.
You must try these 2 foods, just a great pairing to boost your day.
Worth the price as well, very recommended!

Yes! We were looking for a farmers market like this, since they have several of them down in Hoi an. Large selection of fruits, vegetables, plus kitchen items, along with a great choice of places to eat..

I've been eating Bun Bo here from the same husband-wife owned stand since 2018.

A bowl of Bun Bo is 25.000 VND.

Fresh juice, many choices, 15.000 VND.

Motorbike parking outside is 5.000 VND.

Famous local market, you can have very cheap food here and also the fruit price is good. I have my breakfast here with my friend, nth much to shop if you expected something in fashion. a very very local market.

I love the atmosphere, the vendors, and the place. It's local market with local prices. If you want local food and local ingredients, you come here!
You find anything you need here. Fresh seafood, fish, meat, clothes, fresh greens, and fruits. It's great to come in the morning at 8 am, everything is fresh and delicious. Make sure to find the bakery, too! It's smells so nice in the morning when you smell fresh baked bread.
The vendors are always kind and helpful! I had a lady helping me finding some items and she literally took my hand and walked me through the market to ask. We found it and got local price for it :)

reviews.text: Good local market with variety  of veggies,  fruits, good cheap meat , pork and beef,  many groceries.  Very cheap and nice
Great local market, we bought vegetables, fruit, eggs, duck, chicken and suckling pig all delicious and very reasonably priced. Very friendly locals.
It was nice to see the daily lives of the locals.

This is just a small market for the locals. If you want to buy fresh seafood, this is definitely not an ideal place. But beef and pork here are pretty fresh.

I don’t really like the food in this market, basically it doesn’t tasty

I have lived here for 6 months and come to this market atleast 2 times a week. Best market in Da Nang I have been to 4 other markets and the friendliness here is unmatched. When the people begin to recognize you they will begin incorporating free items with your purchases. Not to mention I haven't seen better prices at any other market as well.

data.formatted_address: 119 Trần Phú, Hải Châu 1, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Han Market

reviews.text: The strong fish paste smell left a lingering impression! It was a great experience watching the locals go about their daily groceries, even with the influx of tourists. Be mindful of your valuables, as you'll be squeezing shoulder to shoulder with strangers through the narrow walkways. The storekeepers speak English, Vietnamese (of course), and many also speak Korean. Remember to haggle for good deals!

I found Han Market to be quite a disappointment and a waste of time. It’s now also known as the Korean Market due to the high number of Korean tourists shopping there. The market was extremely crowded, and the prices were very high, even after trying to bargain with the shop owners.

We were particularly frustrated to discover that the same items were much cheaper in Hoi An, which we visited later that same afternoon. Unless you’re visiting for the historical value or looking for something very specific that you can’t find elsewhere, I wouldn’t recommend going to Han Market. It didn’t live up to the hype and left us feeling like we wasted our time.

Fashion must do destination! Come to Vietnam in a pair of shorts and flip flops. Take 3 million VND here and buy enough outfits for the next 3 months. I got Gortex Jacket for Motorcycle and some Russian Amber. North side of market has every imaginable fishing/boating items which surprised 😯 me.
A bit crowded. They hv clothings, nuts, coffee, snacks, crocs, souvenirs etc. Some products are cheaper, some are not. You need to bargain so you wont regret/ get cheated 😊

Cho Han is a typical Vietnamese market that is highly touristy.  I do recommend a visit, but be careful of your valuables as it can get crowded and a perfect opportunity for pickpockets. If you want to see a more local market and a more authentic experience, I would recommend Cho Con, a few blocks away.

data.formatted_address: 362X+42G, 29 An Thượng 29, Bắc Mỹ Phú, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: An Thuong Night Market

reviews.text:
Food are. Very affordable.
Variety ranges from grilled seafood, local Vietnamese cuisine like spring roll, candies, ice cream, fruit shakes. All for less than 500,000 dong

Many shop open till 11pm.

Foot massages ranges from 100k/30mins

Always check your change after buying.

Food stall are very nice and easy to communicate.

Lot of people drink here so be wary.

We ordered pork spring roll and beef grilled in leaf, which cost 160k, all these meal are well prepared and. Tasty.

Also bought 180k for 4 pieces of octopus legs grilled. Always served with veggies and sauce.

Please don't support this market. It is ruining this area in Da Nang. I stayed in a hotel nearby. Loud electronic music that shakes the hotel starting at 8 am. Beach tourists don't want to listen to music blasting all day. Things like this are ruining DaNang.

Loud blasting music for 3 employees. Please close this garbage dump. People come to relax on the beach... Not listen to blasting bad music all day.

I don't understand why so many reviews hate on the night market. It's small, but a great night market. There is some very good street food there. PLEASE don't boycott it because of the karaoke complaints! I lived less than 2 blocks from the night market for over a month and from my experience, there IS NO KARAOKE blasting from the night market. None! However, there is an unrelated bar near the night market that plays loud karaoke, but even that stops at 10pm. The night market consists of small businesses trying to make a living by adding value to the neighborhood. Please support it!
Small night market v few vendors. Not happening. This stall owner and staffs was very polite and kind. Highly recommend!

There's only a few proper food street vendors, the rest is made up of massage businesses, which Da Nang has thousands of already. It really is annoying to be asked every 10 seconds if you want a massage. I couldn't wait to get out of the place. Try the night markets near the Dragon Bridge. They are lots better.

data.formatted_address: 399 Thủ Khoa Huân, Phú Thuỷ, Thành phố Phan Thiết, Bình Thuận 800000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I had a wonderful experience at the spa and massage center. The ambiance was serene and relaxing, with soothing music and pleasant aromas that set the perfect mood for relaxation.

The staff was professional and attentive, ensuring that I felt comfortable throughout my visit.

The massage therapist was highly skilled, applying just the right amount of pressure and focusing on areas that needed extra attention. I left feeling rejuvenated and stress-free.

The spa facilities were clean and well-maintained, adding to the overall positive experience. I highly recommend this spa for anyone looking to unwind and pamper themselves.

The market is really small compared to others. Predominantly selling cheap poor quality clothes here. Zero tourists spotted throughout the whole market, only local people shopping for some stuff. Not much to do here unless you are specifically looking for cheap clothes.
Must try cake ..he is sitting at the end of the market.. everything is good in the market... specially the crocs and cap..mobile accessories

place was really smaller than expected. took us less than 15 mins to walk the whole stretch with some browsing. nothing much really. but the price could be seen as the cheapest, and they put out the price, so it remove the process of unnecessary haggling.
I had a great experience here, total spa package was wonderful. Highly recommend!

I live nearby so it is a convenient place to buy foods. Fresh and locally grown vegetables.
ok

DANA SHOW
