data.formatted_address: 161 Magok-dong, Gangseo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Seoul Botanic Park

reviews.text:
Just go
If you’re going to one botanic park in Korea go here! It’s beautiful and exotic!you’ll find plants from various parts of the world. Very well maintained park! You can easily spend 4-5 hrs here. I also went to the new botanic park in Soo Won but it does not compare with this one. I suggest you wear a good layer of sunscreen and bring a sun umbrella for the outdoor garden.

LOCAL: Super easy to find, well organized, there is a large park before the entrance that can be used.
TICKETS: The adult ticket costs 5,000 won, a very affordable price. You need to buy the ticket at the booth, from the electronic machine.
ENTRANCE: You need your ticket to enter the park area and to enter the wooded area. There will be employees helping you.
FOOD: In the park there is a delicious cafe at a good price.
GARDEN: beautiful, cozy, clean and well organized. There are guides if you want. The place has several typical plants from various locations, such as: Brazil, Istanbul, Korea... There are areas that are very stuffy, so don't go with TOO MUCH clothes.
STORE: There is a shop on the top floor, you can find plants, seeds, souvenirs... THE STORE ONLY ACCEPTS CASH, DOESN'T ACCEPT CARD.

Seoul Botanic Park is huuuge. There is an inside and outside area to see. The outside park is free to visit, the inside of the facility too except for the greenhouse, which is 5000₩ per adult, 2000₩ per kid. The whole place is green, colourful and well maintained, with many benches, toilets, there's also a few restaurants. The place offers insight into gardening, recycling, sustainability, and nature overall.

We did not enter inside as it was too close to closing hours, but we absolutely loved the miniature buildings right outside of the entrance. It's such an adorable and detailed design. My wife loved it so much she had to take a photo of almost every single home!!!

I recently visited Seoul Botanic Garden and it was absolutely breathtaking! The garden is filled with a stunning variety of plants and flowers, creating a peaceful and serene atmosphere. The architecture of the greenhouse is impressive and the displays are beautifully curated. It's a perfect place to relax, take a leisurely stroll, and immerse yourself in nature's beauty. Don't forget to bring your camera, as there are plenty of photo-worthy spots to capture memories. Overall, Seoul Botanic Garden is a must-visit for nature lovers and anyone seeking a tranquil escape.

data.formatted_address: 4 Dobong-dong, Dobong-gu, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Seoul Iris Garden

reviews.text:
The park is stunning but mainly had older people on the occasions that I went. It was still nice and when I was studying Korean on a bench a few of the older women joined me. i still need to explore more of the park which I will do on different days.

There is also a cafe with a great view. I had a cheese toastie with a scoop of chocolate powder on top with a strawberry yoghurt smoothie

Kind of community park at the edge of Seoul. One part is called bunker. One local told me it used to be chemical storage of US military before they moved to Pyeongtaek. Now there are some artist work shops plus couple tanks. I visited on spring Sunday and this park is very colorful with many happy people. It is also the startin point for around Seoul hiking trail. Many foreigners and excellent service from the staff.

It is "Seoul Changpowon". It is a beautiful place where the beauty of iris and the background of Dobongsan and Bukhansan are harmonized throughout the four seasons. The subway station is right next to it, so accessibility is good.

It is a beautiful garden with many flowers and plants. You can see mountains of Seoul here. You can take a walk in the garden and enjoy the greenery. It is very peaceful here. If you want to experience calmness, you need to visit this place.

This park is one of the best places located in Seoul. If you happen to visit Dobong dong area, really like to recommend you to stop by there. Dobong mountain is right in front of the park so you may enjoy this beautiful mountain from the park. And it takes 5 minutes to get from Dobongsan MTR station.

data.formatted_address: 323 Sowol-ro, Yongsan District, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Namsan Outdoor Botanical Garden

reviews.text: Beautiful hike and nature area. Plenty of paved paths as well as natural trails. The trail we took went straight to Seoul tower it was not a super hard trail but I would say not sandal or cowboy boot friendly 😉 please see this beautiful park when visiting Seoul!
Very enjoyable walk through the garden today. Not a lot of parking but the paths are beautiful and my dog enjoyed it as well.

Nice quiet park you can walk. Some parts, the gradient is 20 degrees but it's not that bad. There's a children's park and playground.

Watch out for the big spiders. We almost sat on one at the bench.

No tickets needed but the park was very normal. We walked down from the Seoul Tower, was very plain. Exact same plants as the rest of Korea, no labels or information about the plants. Nothing special, can definitely miss this.
It's a fun trek to get to the spot and much to see on the way, but rather little once you actually get there. Signage of the route is very good.

data.formatted_address: South Korea, Seoul, Gangseo-gu, 가양제1동 619-1
data.name: Theme Gardens

reviews.text: Very lovely and fun. However, I wish there were more interactive parts to the garden. Perhaps after covid19 is under control that the Botanical Garden will add more interactive elements.
It's a beautiful place, but the area is relatively not big, and flowers and trees are not enough yet.

I found out new best place of seoul
You can see many kind of world plant
Then possible to feel like world travel
And also the amenities is great! Pretty cafe and park etc.
I have fun walking there and seeing those beautiful gardens. So relaxing.
Loved this spacious botanic garden!

data.formatted_address: Việt Nam, ĐT20, Sơn Trạch, Bố Trạch, Quảng Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Phong Nha Botanic Garden

reviews.text:
Quite an enjoyable visit. Similar to another reviewer here I made the mistake of assuming this would be a traditional botanic garden (my bad there in not doing the due diligence).

Instead, it offers a forest or jungle walk experience which was quite nice albeit rather hot and humid (in April): The surroundings are beautiful, but it's important to note that the longer walk can be challenging if you’re not used to walking in humid weather. The view from the waterfall was quite picturesque and quite a few folks took a dip in the pool. The viewing point, however, may not offer as rewarding a view and can be difficult to access, making it less worthwhile.

Overall quite a decent place and well worth the visit

The Botanic Gardens, while enjoyable to visit, might not meet expectations as a traditional botanic garden. Instead, it offers a forest or jungle walk experience. The surroundings are beautiful, but it's important to note that the longer walk can be challenging. The view from the waterfall is picturesque, offering a glimpse into the jungle, but the viewing point may not offer as rewarding a view and can be difficult to access, making it less worthwhile. Personally, I found cycling around the area and exploring nature to be a more fulfilling experience, but this preference may vary from person to person.

This garden is lovely, it is more of a walk in the forest as opposed to a botanical garden in the UK. The trees, and other flora that you'll see are wonderful and it is cooler due to the foliage. The view point is nice, a little overgrown but you get an evening nicer one towards the end, spoilers in the pictures. We swam at the Gio falls as well and it was so cool and refreshing, exactly what was needed. We did the 1.5 hour route, but there is also a 0.5 hour and 3 hour route available.

TLDR: very nice walk - recommended, use proper shoes and take enough water and a little energy snack.
....
We cycled all the way from Phong nha to the botanic garden. We had very bad bikes but it was no problem at all. Mostly flat.

BUT: last 800 m are very steep. If you have no gears you need to walk and push.
Please be careful on way back down as these old bikes might not break well enough. Huge risk of crashing. Just walk down as we did.

At the garden bicycles park for free, scooter 5.000 and cars 10.000.

Entrance is 40.000 per person

There are various walks of 0.5 h to 3h.
We did the long walk and it took us 2h in total. So not the 3 h as advertised.

On the way you will find a couple of water holes where people apparently like to cool down.

We didn't but it looked safe. At the end of the walk there is a medium size waterfall with bathing option.

The walk (long one) starts uphill on a path with concrete steps. Easy enough for average fit people.
It is very beautiful and serene.

The last bit before the waterfall was very steep and a little slippery.
There are ropes to support you but a certain strength, agility and balance is needed.
Not recommended in sandals.

There is a little store for drinks/restaurant in front of the garden to charge your battery afterwards.

As a life long motorbike rider, I am always looking for really winding / challenging roads....well is the best I have ever been on. If you google map the surround roads here you will be thrilled but if you choose some longer journeys that will take hours make sure you have survival essentials like water, food, lighter to start fire, knife for defense against anything wild if you're broken down / flat tyre or stacked it no traffic passing no houses near by no ph reception so don't go it alone or without essentails, it is very rewarding ride with so many great pics

data.formatted_address: 3 Đ. Hoàng Hoa Thám, Ngọc Hồ, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn bách thảo Hà Nội

reviews.text:
Nice park, can't walk on the grass. Lots of locals enjoying the green space.

Unfortunately the man who parks the bikes tried to scam us by charging us even tho we didn't have a bike.

Monkey's in a very small cage with the smell of ammonia.

For these reasons that is why I have given it 2 star.

I visited recently and paid 2000VND to enter. The garden itself had a quiet ambiance, which was somewhat relaxing.

However, I couldn't overlook the poor conditions of the caged animals. It felt like a step back in time, and frankly, it's surprising that such practices still exist today.

As I walked through, I couldn't help but wonder about the necessity of keeping animals in such conditions. It's something that needs serious reconsideration.

Overall, the visit left me with mixed feelings – a peaceful environment tainted by outdated practices.

This is a botanical garden in the center of Hanoi. It is not the most impressive garden from a botanical perspective but it is a very beautiful park and a very welcoming break from the crowds and noise in Hanoi. The gardens are big and the park also offers an outdoor arts display of sculptures from different international artists.
Nice trees. Disappointing to see dude fishing in the botanical gardens lake. Security guard didn't seem to care blackout it either, despite the signs saying fishing is forbidden.  Crazy. Lol.
One of (if not) the most historic, well-reserved botanical places in the city of Ha Noi. Very close to the West Lake and Old Quarter’ streets.

data.formatted_address: XXVW+X8P, Hoà Phú, Hòa Vang, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn Giác Quan

reviews.text: Many stone statues simulate the senses. Beautiful space, on the majestic Ba Na peak.

In a corner of Ba Na hill, there are quite interesting large statues of human senses such as: heads, legs, hands... so big.
It's fun to take pictures of trolls here, for example, carrying a giant leg, or being crushed... it's just that the sensory images aren't particularly colorful.
This area also has hydrangeas, so checking is quite ok
It's strange, the way through can be a beautiful corner.
The landscape here is very beautiful, meticulously and methodically invested. This place has many types of cold-country flowers, a destination not to be missed when visiting Ba Na peak.
It's a beautiful and interesting garden. Another garden was created around the arm, leg, and head statues. It's a photo spot.

data.formatted_address: 105 Namsangongwon-gil, Yongsan District, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: N Seoul Tower

reviews.text: We recommend going when its dark, maybe 2-3 hours before they close so you can still get some food and enjoy your stay. Going at night was a much better experience as you can overlook  the city lights and it felt more romantic if you're going as a couple. We loved our experience and would come back!

100% recommend. It's BETTER THAN visiting Lotte World Tower (which cost 39,000 including a drink at 123 Seoul). We didn't even go up the Namsam Tower because the views were amazing without having to go up it (and we already went up Lotte tower that day). We also got a cable car to the tower however I'm pretty sure you can also take the stairs for free. You really don't need to go up to the tower to see amazing views.

Have to know exactly how to get there. Our taxi driver dropped me and my sister off at the foot of the park and we were somewhat confused as to how to get there. We found ourselves walking or better yet hiking up the mountain. Glad we did. There were multiple view stops to take in the beautiful view of Seoul and see from afar. The tower itself was unique. You can dine in there and enjoy the atmosphere up in the mountaintop. Make sure to purchase your ticket ahead of time as it is cheaper online. I purchase my sister and my ticket for only $7.50 each. The top of the tower was small but the scenery was breathtaking. After that made our way to the lover lock bridge and was nice but the highlight for us was the cart rail going down the mountain. Made our trip easy and breezy. Seoul Tower Check!

Absolutely amazing views! I was incredibly happy to hike up to Seoul Tower. There are many outdoor gyms to visit. The biodiversity is truly amazing. I loved seeing the different flora and I was especially intrigued by the stickbugs:) Be careful not to step on them!

I recently hiked up to N Seoul Tower with my husband, and it was a fantastic experience! While I've taken the cable car before, which was also enjoyable, hiking provided a great bit of exercise and a fresh perspective of the beautiful surroundings. At the top, we visited the cafe where I had a refreshing iced plum tea—perfect after the climb. The panoramic views of Seoul from the observation deck are breathtaking. The tower itself, a key broadcasting and observation site since 1969, offers not just great views but also interesting attractions like the "Locks of Love." It's a must-visit for anyone looking to experience Seoul from above. Highly recommend for a blend of activity and leisure!

data.formatted_address: 14 Thanh Lương 11, Hoà Xuân, Cẩm Lệ, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam Eco-Tours - Day Tours

reviews.text:
We recently went on a bird-watching tour with Vietnam Eco-Tours to Bach Ma National Park and had an absolutely wonderful experience. The tour guide, Luc, was extremely knowledgeable about the local bird species and was able to spot and identify even the most elusive birds.
We saw 46 different bird species during the 3 days tour, plus a Common Palm Civet as bonus. The tour took us through a beautiful nature preserve with diverse habitats, allowing us to see a wide variety of birds in their natural environments.
The private group with two, made it easy to ask questions and get personalised attention from the guide. Luc was patient in helping us to get good views through the spotting scopes provided.
I would highly recommend this bird tour to anyone, whether you're a seasoned birdwatcher or just getting started. It was an informative and thoroughly enjoyable experience. I left feeling like I learned so much and got to see some amazing birds up close. We have already booked another tour with Luc for this Dec.

Great experience with my four other family members. Luc and the company’s driver were extremely friendly and Luc was very knowledgeable about the places and animals we saw. Would recommend and had a great time :)

We had an amazing day with Vietnam Eco-Tours! After an insightful morning excursion to Marble Mountain and Lady Buddha, Luc treated us to an amazing picnic lunch at the top of a mountain overlooking Da Nang Bay. We had some special requests for our meal due to our dietary restrictions, which he met without complaint and the meal he packed was excellent. After lunch he took us on a hike to look for the Red-shanked Douc Langurs. Despite us visiting on a Sunday when there is more traffic in the area than usual, he was able to get us some really great views of these shy primates! Luc clearly has a lot of experience not only with finding wildlife, but with helping photographers get the shots they want as well. He knew exactly where to put me to get the best shots. He also had some neat tricks to help me get some better looks at some of the birds that lived along the trail. All in all, I can heartily recommend Luc to anyone looking to do a wildlife tour in Vietnam, and I hope I can take another tour with him on my next trip.

We booked a private tour leading from the North to Central of Vietnam (Van Long, Cat Ba, Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, Son Tra Peninsula, Bach Ma National Park and finally Buon Me Thuot). We saw a lot of endemic dangered langurs and spotted a lot of bird species we love the see.

Luc is a brilliant birding guide and a wildlife specialist. His high class experience justifies the reasonable tour cost. If you are looking for a professional local expert- he is definitely your man!

This was a top experience. Luc is a an amazing guide who truely loves his job. We saw 3 families of Red monkeys quite close and Luc gives you binoculars to watch them better. Highly recommened and a must if you are in Hoi An and Danang. Thanks for everything Luc!

reviews.text: Breath taking view!! The most beautiful waterfall I have ever seen!!! Great experience  taking cable car as a hotel guest.
Really scenic cable car ride passing by Toc Tien Waterfall.

If you're heading to Mercure hotel at Ba Na Hills, key in this place on Grab. It's cheaper than when you key in Mercure Da Nang Ba Na Hills, AND Grab driver will only bring you up to this station.

Payment will be done at the "check in" counter here at Toc Tien Waterfall.
This station will take you to French village on top of the Ba Na hills, the longest cable car line here so far, the journey takes 15 mins to get there.

data.formatted_address: My Khe Beach, 550000, Vietnam
data.name: My Khe Beach

reviews.text: One side of this beach is covered with developed hotels , there are pretty hustle bustle around the beach with night markets, lots of food options. This one isn’t one of the windy beaches as compared to others though, so I see many people visiting beach during early morning or late evening to kill the heat.
Highly crowded beach with families and kids in the evening. The beach is good with lots of acty available. But if you are looking for a quite place to lie down, this is not the one

Amazing beach! Lots of activities.
Lots of people too. Clear water and you can see small fish swimming

A nice beach. The beach is wide and sandy, there is pretty good tourist infrastructure, with many beach chairs and umbrellas (at c. 40k, per chair.) drinks and food are widely available and the water isn't that cold. The shallow water goes on for a good while 40 maybe 50 yards from shore, so swimming is actually kinda challenging especially if you're tall. The negatives are a lot of no swimming zones with red flags, and cigarette butts in the sand...

Great beach! Lots of sand and space to hang out. The water was clean. It seems like the local government is doing a lot to ensure everyone enjoys their time on the beach. For example, no sports are allowed on the beach. There are many restaurants just off the sand as well as a fitness area with makeshift weights, and bars for calisthenics.

data.formatted_address: Black Rock Beach, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Black Rock Beach

reviews.text: No easy to reach, a bit kind of adventure. Unfortunately beach is very dirty need definitely clean up. It takes you around 10-15 min to get through the forest from the bike parking till the beach. Attention you need to have a manual scooter to go up there - others are not permitted.

Full of waste! See pics. On the main beach are some fire places from people and around of every fire place are beer cans and plastic stuff. Why nobody takes a little bit care of our planet earth? One bottle of water keeps us for 3-4 hours alive and ends up on the beach for so many years. Think twice before throwing any plastic away
Would be a beautiful spot if not for the piles of plastic bowls, cups, and beer cans everywhere. Paid 15k to park, maybe they should use some of the fee to keep the area clean.
It is a wonderful place to hike a little bit!
Beach is really gross, a lot of plastic, brown water, but you are alone at the beach!

data.formatted_address: My Khe Beach, Phước Mỹ, Sơn Trà, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam

reviews.text: A very big, long white sandy beach. It's quite comfortable and not feeling crowdy at all. Sea is a bit rough and people is allowed to swim within designated areas only. People can play water sports. A beautiful place to stroll around, take a break and relax here.

Worthy of the title of the most attractive beach on the planet, My Khe has affirmed its appeal with a large number of tourists all year round. Coming to My Khe beach, visitors not only have the opportunity to immerse themselves in the vast space of the sea but also participate in many other extremely interesting activities. Join Traveloka to discover all the experiences of traveling to My Khe beach - a destination that captures the hearts of "travel" enthusiasts right here!

Tourists can go to My Khe beach to travel at many times of the year, however the time when My Khe beach is most beautiful is probably still from April to September of the solar calendar. At this time, the sun is gentle and bright, the sea is calm, extremely suitable for relaxing or participating in exciting outdoor activities.
Nice lively beach. I enjoyed watching local families having fun in their beautiful city, swimming together.

Stupid rules imposed about swiming. They are pushing all peopel together crowded in some specific places and aside that places the safeguard stay and watch for no people to get in to water. Avoid this beach and in general Da Nang beaches if you don't want some idi.ts to ruin your holidays

This is a very nice beach with silky sand. Generally clean coastline.

I could see the sunrise across the beach from my hotel room. So it must be even nicer to catch the sunrise from the beach itself.

No swimming. But there are people surf boarding etc. the waves are good for it.

data.formatted_address: Bãi tắm Mân Thái, Hoàng Sa, Mân Thái, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Man Thai beach

reviews.text: This place is really cool and worth going too, you see a lot less tourists here and a lot more local people, they have some street food available/drinks, of course don't expect it to be a main beach bar restaurant level, the area is really cool to chill out and have a drink, have a look at the pictures, they have a sup centre next to it if you are coming during the day !

The beach itself is quite nice, but lacks essential facilities like changing rooms.

To avoid the intense heat, it's best to visit after 4pm.

Without proper amenities, this beach is more suitable for those seeking a quick, casual visit rather than an extended day at the seaside.

Beautiful beach, may by my favorite in Da Nang. It's not overcrowded, even at sunset, as the beach in the center. I usually go there to do my yoga 🧘‍♀️.  It's also nice to swim there. At sunrise you can buy fresh fish and seafood from fishermen. Love this place.

This is not the beach for going in the water, so if that's what you're looking for, you probably want to go south to My Khe Beach. But if you want a beautiful place to sit and watch the fishing boats, have a drink and relax, this is one of my favorite places in Da Nang.
The Son Tra sign is there, with Quan Am sitting next to the mountain watching over the beach. It's very peaceful and very beautiful.

Bãi tắm Mân Thái in Đà Nẵng is a serene coastal paradise. Its pristine sandy beach and clear waters offer tranquility and relaxation. With fewer crowds compared to other beaches in the area, it's an ideal spot to unwind and enjoy the natural beauty of Đà Nẵng.

data.formatted_address: Bãi Đá, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Bãi Đá

reviews.text: Looks very beautiful, especially during sunset. The rocks make a nice contrasts to sun. We stayed shortly and did not try seimming. However, needs to be mentioned, there was a lot of stuff scrumbled around, some trash, some lady talking to us constantly in Vietnamese (did not figure out what)...
Small rocky beach, you can walk on rocks and see crabs running away :) easy to get to, worth a visit👍

A failure at all levels. Do not waste your time here.

The amount of garbage and noise from karaoke is shameful. Some locals don't know how to appreciate the natural beauty of their country and just treat this as a garbage dump for all kinds of plastic. The photos you see here do not show the reality of what this place is.

The police should be stationed permanently to scare people into behaving civilly or, unfortunately, an expensive private resort needs to be built nearby to protect this from happening (as is the case in many places in Vietnam). I know some day this will improve in Vietnam but for now don't go to this place and be left with a terrible impression of Vietnam...it's better to stick to Da Nang beach or An Bang beach.

Wonderful place,  I went there with some friends and I had a great time here. Your guys can come here for many activities such as fishing, swimming, team-building or simply relax...  A place to be... 👍👍👍👍👍
Good place for BBQ, swimming and see the sun goes down to mountain!

data.formatted_address: 2 Phạm Văn Đồng, Phước Mỹ, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Da Nang Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful pristine and a clean beach, early mornings you will see many yoga and workout classes going on just on the beach.. Sunset and evening views are just marvellous, in the night the entire beach area becomes a party destination with tourists and locals thronging the beach to have some fun times..

Beautiful Beach
Had a lovely walk along the beach
There were people everywhere
We watched locals picking up and collecting jellyfish, fishing with nets, surfing and para sailing.
It was nice and warm
Love my beach walks
Lovely long beach that goes for miles
Beautiful beach. Cold winds and mountains in the background. The sand is clean and very soft. Worth a visit
Fun beach to hang at. Big mountainous & sky views. Plenty of seating options. It gets lit around 5-7p.
Clean beautiful beach close to Hilton danang.  Plenty of places to eat, drink or just relax with the view.

data.formatted_address: Biển Thanh Bình, Ông Ích Khiêm, Thanh Bình, Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Biển Thanh Bình

reviews.text:
One of the beautiful beach in the world is Da Nang beach. I have opportunity living here for 3 months, Da Nang city is very beautiful and peaceful. The Da Nang citizen is very friendly. You should get there at least 1 time when you come to VietNam. But there is the problem which there are many Chinese come here. As you know, i am so sorry when i say that almost people live in Da Nang do not like Chinese because of .... (You can answer that when you come here).
In the general, Da Nang is the very beautiful city in VietNam. Welcome to VietNam and welcome to Da Nang

My childhood, in the morning my grandmother took us here for swimming. Year after, land clearance poor fishing village replaced by wide road not many people come for swimming but couples wander and  contemplate immerse ocean.

The pin location of this beach was placed inside a new international urban area, which is gated and inaccessible to the public (KHU ĐÔ THỊ MỚI QUỐC TẾ ĐA PHƯỚC).

I haven't found other ways to access this beach yet.
Walked for more than 2km to find a way to access it, because of the "construction building site". I guess now it's a private beach.
There should definitely be more tourist coming to this beach instead My Khe beach

data.formatted_address: W87R+C7R, Đ. Hai Bà Trưng, Tp. Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: An Bang Beach

reviews.text:
This beach is prime territory for people-watching.

From the yoga enthusiasts attempting headstands (and sometimes toppling over) to the surfers waiting for that perfect wave (or a perfect wipeout), there’s never a dull moment.

The beach dogs add to the charm, trotting around like they own the place – and frankly, they probably do.

Nice Beach with a long stretch of brown sand around. I reached there at 5 AM in the morning and to my surprise there were a lot of locals already taking a dip in the sea. It seemed like daily practice for them to take a bath in the rising sun and do some exercises to start the day with.

It was a very calming experience and great insight into the local living style in that region.

Tip: If you are taking a grab bike ride to the beach, make sure you arrange the way back as well, I was not able to find any Grab at 7:30 AM from the beach to Hoi An, and I had to take a lift.

Great, long stretched beach with few people. Nice place to relax, swim and surf when waves are ok. Sun beds are included when buying a meal or coffee. Beautiful mornings with lots of activity both by locals and visitors!

An Bang Beach is an ideal destination for those who love vibrant and lively atmospheres.
Its fine white sand and crystal-clear waters attract many visitors seeking relaxation and enjoyment by the sea. The bustling crowds create an energetic ambiance, complemented by the large waves that make the beach experience exciting and exhilarating.

It truly is a must-visit destination for those looking to explore and appreciate the natural beauty of the ocean.

The beach was a lovely white sand beach and you could rent a lounger for 50,000 dong for the entire day!

There’s plenty of nice restaurants a short walk away too and nice spots to go to have a refreshing drink or a cocktail.

Sad that we couldn’t stay until the sunset but the skyline later on in the day was amazing and really a must see!

data.formatted_address: Bãi biển Tiên Sa, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Bãi biển Tiên Sa

reviews.text:
We managed to sneak through the (closed?) Navy hotel entrance and have a swim whilst watching the locals unsuccessfully catch fish.

It was a good few secluded hours. We went to have a  drink at the empty beach resort but they wanted 10 dollars for a soft drink. Transport out of the peninsula is difficult/expensive.

It's about 20 mins from My Khe beach but utterly different  - very quiet  just one beach club there where you can use their facilities if you eat or drink something.
We hired scooters, don't be put off by the container port next to it! On the beach you're not aware of it.
Good for swimming,  no crashing waves

Beautiful and quiet, there was a beach bar on it before Dec 2022, the beach has been quiet ever since. Great place for sunset view in Da Nang, a little bit tricky to find, you will need to pay entrance fee of 10,000 VND (~0.4 USD)

A good beach to swim. However, it's quite crowded in the afternoon, which is not my style. Something you may want to know:
#1: Parking fee: 10k/bike, 20k/car (after Navy Hotel's gate)
#2: You can rent boat here to row 200-300k/hour
#3: There is a nice hotel (Navy Hotel) and restaurant here if you want to stay
#4: There are several spots shaded by coconut trees where you can sit and chill with your friend.
#5: Fresh water shower is available

Place slightly hidden, have to pay resort 10000dong for entry & scooter parking.

But once you go in, it's definitely less crowded than popular beaches like my khe beach & it's a good place to see the sunset!

data.formatted_address: 473X+VJ5, Hoàng Sa, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: South Beach Son Tra

reviews.text: Definitely worth renting a motorbike and riding around this area! Lots of viewpoints with lovely views. It was raining when we went but was still stunning! Monkeys along the road too!

Lovely beach, great spot to see the sunset. Not so many tourists (even though when we were there, people sang karaoke quite loud). It also depends on the tide, when the tide down, you can see the whole beach with rocks, very lovely

Place got beautiful wheel, but the resort need a lot of updates,  abit to far from the city, but great for weekend get away from
The noise
Rent a moped and drive here. Great view points and you get to see the monkeys 🐒

What a shame! Beach access has been removed and a wall erected. Now a no entry sign stands where the path was and a hotel and spa to be constructed. Barbed wire also erected, creating a hazard for wildlife. It was a beautiful beach where you had beautiful water in front of you and monkey's playing in the trees behind you. Conservation has been ignored it seems. What made the beach unique will now be gone.

data.formatted_address: Võ Nguyên Giáp/101 Ward, Street, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Pullman Danang Beach Resort

reviews.text: The overall experience was good. We stayed for 2 nights. The pool was very good especially for those who like to swim. Room was clean. Room service sometimes slow (we need to call 2-3 times for yoga mattress, 1 time we call for room clean up but no staff came) but the staffs are in general helpful and friendly. It would be better if they improves more playgrounds for kids to make the resort more family friendly.

Excellent beach-side resort.  Spent a very relaxing two days. Food is very good. Breakfast buffet is one of the mist extensive offerings I've experienced.  Nice pool area, and sun loungers by the beach, with bar and restaurant.  Service is attentive and friendly. A great place to unwind.

Our second stay here was perfect. The hotel is spotlessly clean, staff are extremely polite, friendly & nothing is too much trouble. The food is amazing in both  restaurants. Breakfast has everything, amazing quality and care. The rooms are spacious with everything you want. Kept very clean and updated. Gardens are immaculate. Everything you want from a holiday hotel. We save a long time for long haul holidays and this worth every penny spent. Would always recommend anyone to stay there.

The reception area was welcoming and the hotel staff were nice and helpful.

The room was spacious with balcony. The bed mattress was too soft for me, but I found that is an issue (maybe for me only) across Accor group not only this hotel. Another downside was the view as the beach was in a distance.

Breakfast was quite nice with a variety of selection of food, including local Vietnamese, western, Japanese, Chinese and Indonesian. The pizza and salad at Infinity Bar were also tasty. The room service seemed to share the same menu with Infinity Bar.

Most importantly, they have a well-equipped gym and beach behind. So, it’s quite nice to do some workouts and have a walk in the mornings during my stay.

Good location and friendly staff. The only comment would be that the security should not be rushing people out of the pool before 10pm when the welcome letter indicates otherwise, especially after checking with the reception whether we can still go for a swim. That was not called for and felt bit rude at the same time. Internet in the room seems to be not very stable and is a challenge to work due to inconsistency.  Overall a good stay with decent facilities of a resort. The beach is lovely. Thank you for the stay.

data.formatted_address: 21 Trường Sa, Hoà Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Sandy Beach Non Nuoc Resort

reviews.text:
Had a wonderful stay at the resort!

While they didn’t allow early check-in even by an hour, they were kind enough to keep our bags (so many bags) in their storage completely safe while we had breakfast, went to the beach and even went outside to explore.

The rooms were absolutely clean and hygienic. The breakfast menu was enough (and little bit of Indian food as well as I noticed lot of Indian guests at the resort).

It was too cold to step into the swimming pool, it was well managed. We also played pool near one of the restaurants inside.

The private beach was a cherry on top!! Absolutely loved my stay here. Highly recommend to stay in this resort if you’re on a budget but always want luxury.

The hotel was really nice and clean. The staff were nice and helpful. The beach was very wide, spacious and clean. Although the sea was quite wavy in most days, it was nice to enjoy the sun on the beach. The pool was nice, they clean it constantly. The whole resort is really peaceful. Even though it’s busy, you hardly see other people walking around. They offer free breakfast; it is okay even though they kept messing up our eggs lol. The hotel is quite close to both Danang and Hoian so it is easy to commute to either. They also kindly upgraded our room because we were in our honeymoon. I’m quite happy with the stay and I’d definitely come back here if I am to be back ever.

As someone who was looking for a private, quiet vacation near the beach, pretty that's what I got. Yes I booked the cheapest room there but it still exceeded my expectations. Room was very big and spacious. Staff were lovely with just the right dash of "let me have my space" and offering assistance.
As advertised the resort had its own private path to the private beach meaning we were all resort guests, no loudness or street vendors trying to sell you things while you're sunbathing or taking a nap.

Sandy beach was a little treat from our backpacking budget. The place is a little tired around the edges, but still very comfortable, clean and spacious for a great price. I give 5 stars because the buffet breakfast was fantastic. The only negative was the beach front pool being closed early for a wedding, it didn’t greatly affect us but pre warning via a message would be appreciated.

The staff are super friendly. The location is amazing if you are looking for a relaxing beach holiday. You have your own private beach and two swimming pools. It also has a very decent gym for a hotel.
The outside area and garden is absolutely beautiful and well kept.

data.formatted_address: Lot 39 An Thượng 30, Bắc Mỹ Phú, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Danang Beach Hotel

reviews.text: For the price, this place is awesome with air con, fridge,  tv, comfortable beds...but it's a little noisy with doors closing, and other sounds (music, talking, etc.) travelling easily to all the rooms from even downstairs.  The wifi is okay, but not so fast and there is no elevator for the 4 floors of the hotel.  The staff is pleasant and speak good enough English.

The places is clean and spacious. Toilet and shower are not separated so it will get wet. However it's like this in most vn cheaper hostels anyway. There are a few good restaurants nearby and is very close to the beach. Host were very friendly and helpful as well. You can rent scooter here too.

We liked the rooms, they are nice and clean, The staff was very friendly and helpfull, they offered us a really good deal on the taxi to Hoi An and the scooter we rent. The staff speaks good English. We also had no noise issue, room was on the other side so no construction nois. We can not think of anything we did not like there. Oh there was no elevator, that was no problem for us but it could be a problem for other people. They did helped us with carrying the luggage. Best value in town!

Fairly priced.
Staffs are friendly and they understand and speak english. Due to some reason I had to prepone my visit by 1 day.
They reschduled the dates without making any mess.
Rooms are okay.
Washrooms are a bit small. For a 6 feet person it is difficult to sit on the commode.
It is close to the beaches (my khe and other beaches).
Bike on rent is also available here.
For 2-3 days trip I would say it is okay.

Stayed in this hotel for three nights, the condition of the room wasn’t excellent, we noticed an oily spot on the bed sheet and some other small stuff. Our room during our stay wasn’t cleaned once, draining in the shower was also not great. But the staff was nice, they gave us free water as a compensation for the power cut.

data.formatted_address: 273C+42, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Da Nang 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Bãi Tắm Non Nước

reviews.text: Great beachfront! Not busy at all. There does appear to be a lifeguard available. Clean sand and beautiful views!

Nice beachfront, mostly clean with bins near entrance for trash. Good lifeguard station, well sign posted.

You can park scooters near beach, not sure about parking for cars maybe near the shops on the road.
beach is deserted most of day and beautiful.Locals use in morning and afternoon.
So good
Clean, less people, have sea security,

data.formatted_address: 103, 105 Võ Nguyên Giáp, Khuê Mỹ, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Furama Resort Danang

reviews.text: The overall hotel outlook is amazing, with clean and spacious rooms. The two swimming pools are beautiful for taking photos, and the hotel provides a fitness center and spa services. The location of the hotel was convenient, a short distance to some famous spots with Grab, and we could walk to the K-market and spa nearby too. Lastly, the services and attitudes of staffs is wonderful, we enjoyed a chill trip here~

Breakfast service is excellent, plenty of choices from local cuisine, to usual international dishes. Staff is attentive, friendly and helpful. Room and amenities are good. The beach is our favorite. Crystal clear water, gentle waves. Pool and beach service are on point.

Booked an Ocean Deluxe room because I really want a room very close to the ocean . Turned out wasn’t too bad , though there’s still a distance to the ocean. Resort is really nice  and breakfast is splendid and the private beach ideal for those whom want privacy . If you want some nightlife though , you can take a grab to nearby My Khe public beach which has a lot of beach restaurants and bars. Complementary fruits offered at room could have been better as the banana seems to be slightly rotten. Other than that , we have a nice stay . There’s also a Club 99 which is something like a jackpot machines or online casino room for foreigners for you to spend time , though I’m not sure if it’s 24 hours.

My room had the greatest view ever, looking at the sea. If you do not like to swim in the sea (which would be a shame) you can also swim in the ocean water pool of the hotel, which is immaticutally well kept. I loved the room, spacious, wonderful wooden floor, balcony. Nothing left to wish for. The service was allover not only super friendly but also pleasant and efficient.

We stayed here for 5 days/4 nights in a 2-bedroom villa with private pool. Overall, the experience was okay but I don't think I would stay here again.

We arrived very early and went to the main lobby to check in but were told to go to the villa lobby. That's fine, except the villa reception is very small and not a great first impression when spending $500-600 a night. No water, juice or towels were offered which I saw given to guests checking in at the main lobby.

We came back at 2pm and were taken by buggy to our villa. The grounds are well kept and the villas are quite nice. Our butler showed us around andr have us an explanation on the villa and resort.

I find it very cheap to not provide guests staying in villas with enough water. You're not supposed to drink the tap water and you have to make your own ice and they only give you 2 small bottles per person. Not even a liter a day.

While the interiors were nice and the pool was a treat, we were placed on the eastern edge of the resort by their small farm and every morning between 5:30-6am roosters and other birds would start crowing. Make sure to request a villa far from here if you want to sleep in.

We had dinner in the main restaurant for their steak and seafood buffet. It was good value, especially with the free flow wine option, but there were two problems. The center table of fresh live seafood you can have prepared to your liking was not explained to us and there was almost never a server there to help. Second, the restaurant was kept very warm.

We had breakfast at the villa restaurant and the main restaurant. Go to the main restaurant. The villa one is small, less options, and the air conditioning barely works. The air conditioning in the main restaurant isn't much better but there's more variety of food.

Housekeeping was quick but refused to give us more towels. Other staff were kind of helpful. The buggy drivers were nice.

The location is close to a few good restaurants and small markets to buy snacks. It's easy to order a grab to Marble Mountain, Lady Buddha and the airport.

I expected a more premium experience booking a villa but it seemed we got worse quality check-in and breakfast experiences than regular guests. They need to provide more drinking water and provide better air conditioning in common areas and restaurants.

data.formatted_address: Sơn Trà Mountain, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Sơn Trà Mountain

reviews.text:
If you’re a big fan of monkeys, you might be a bit disappointed with Monkey Mountain. We only saw one during our visit. However, if you appreciate bonsai, you’ll find the beautifully maintained plants scattered throughout the premises truly delightful.

The temple on Monkey Mountain is stunning, featuring a larger version of the pagodas found at Marble Mountain. It was amazing to see the humongous Guan Yin statue up close. The view of the city from the perspective of the big statue is absolutely glorious. Despite the scarcity of monkeys, the combination of beautiful bonsai, impressive temples, and breathtaking views made the visit worthwhile.

The monkeys are WILD, got to see a monkey attack in person 10/10.

FYI no automatic bikes allowed and there is a security checkpoint to check but we were able to rent a semi auto from the guard for 100k VND just to drive up to the top.

Beautiful view of Da Nang from the top as well so definitely worth the trip.
The Lady Buddha’ or ‘The Goddess of Mercy’ facing the sea. According to local no more storm in danang since this was built. Cooling and very nice place, you are able to see the city view from there

we left hoi an town but still had time for our flight to Hanoi so visited this place, called monkey mountain near Danang city.
it's just on the shore of the sea and at good height so provides marvelous views of sea.
very large Buddha statue is visible from far distance from the Danang beach.
pagoda and garden are also there.
eatery provides food and drinks at very reasonable price that's plus point as this is rare in Vietnam!!
over-all good place to visit for 3-4 hours
Warning: this viewpoint tag is actually a military base - the entire area was great for hiking and sightseeing but avoid this peak as it is restricted access.

data.formatted_address: W846+M59, Tha Phai, Laos
data.name: Nakai-Nam Theun National Park

reviews.text: Quiet and relax area, the closest place to see shooting stars in Laos
Beautiful, don't forget to bring a jacket or warm cloths
Interesting area to wander around and take some photos.
This is one of the most important protected areas in South-east Asia for is high biodiversity and presence of glabally significant flora and fauna.
Nice park. Got there by motorcycle, back way by boat

data.formatted_address: 367H+PW4, Đ. Trần Hưng Đạo, An Hải, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: DHC Marina

reviews.text: Beautiful place. The perfect place to get the view of dragon bridge. People put locks as a symbol of love in the sidewalk.
The views were nice but the boat was closed at the time for renovations.
An amazing place for a walk along the river and watch the dragon Fire and Water show during the weekend

Fantastic place to visit at night around 6 PM, or whenever it gets dark. We didn’t actually eat in this restaurant, as it looked overpriced and not tasty, but the pictures from this area are absolutely fantastic!

This place looks lovely from the outside but it was terrible. Everything on the menu is overpriced but we thought it would be really nice so we went with it. We ordered cheese chicken pasta and there was a pinch of cheese, dry pasta and chicken was on the side on bones which is not what we asked for. We didn’t bother to ask for a redo of the food as we were willing to pay and leave 90% of it just to save hassle. My boyfriend paid and was asked outright if they could keep his change as a tip (despite us not enjoying the food at all). Then found out that they charged us double price for a beer which we had to correct. It’s hassle and not enjoyable. I don’t even leave bad reviews but this was BAD.

data.formatted_address: Bù Gia Mập, Đồng Xoài, Binh Phuoc, Vietnam
data.name: Bu Gia Map National Park

reviews.text: Just 3 hrs drive from ho chi minh to BU GIA MAP, we was back to nature where we left our work, our phone, our busy life … outside of forest for 2 day 1. I had choosed HÀNH TRÌNH BU GIA MẬP who was organising the gruop tour, they did excellent job by  friendly guide- helpful porter- good cook team. I enjoyed so much.. it worth for package tour ( value for money) . I will back with them for another tour and will introduce to Al my friend who love trekking
Visit Bu Gia Map National Forest in the most beautiful time in the end of Apr, early May, when millions of butterfly migrate to somewhere secret deep inside the forest for mating season.

a very good place to visit and explore nature with friends or families... best place to unplug from technology... a beautiful forest/natural park... forest guides are friendly and experts in what they do... i’m just hoping that campers, hikers and visitors avoid throwing trash (candy and food wrappers) anywhere in the campsite and along the trail...

The forest near HCMCity. 2 days turn off mobile. We have chance to touch the real nature in Bu Gia Map forest. We see more the huge trees, listen deeply the waterfall, look at your friends's eye. We talk each others more in face to face, don't watch your FB, youtube and Netflix.
Appreciate the god, family to have me a chance to see beautiful world. Thankful

Amazing to live with the nature. Long ride from HCMC around 8 hours, but it is really worth for. You should go with the local tour guide here named Mr Giang, then you can enjoy the forest cusine and the very special experirment here.

data.formatted_address: 4XFF+P7V, Tân Sơn District, Phu Tho Province, Vietnam
data.name: Xuan Son National Park

reviews.text: Amazing place that you have to come there once in summer! Very nature, quiet and tranquality. We stayed in Muong house without booking in advance and they hosted us warmly with delicious food. You should spend there at least 2 days to explore the river, cave, waterfall and climb the mountain there. Highly recommend!
Nice national park with limestone forest, fresh air
Beautiful mountains, caves and waterfalls. Hiking is also good. Fresh air,  cozy mountainous life, delicious chicken and crab.

Really good park that is still fairly wild. A fee homestays in there and they are ok.
The road there is pretty good apart from small patches that are being upgraded. Easy driving.
Super forest scene, awesome trees and plants. We had great walks in this forest.

data.formatted_address: CH8C+P2W, Bắc Bình District, Bình Thuận, Vietnam
data.name: Kalon Song Mao Nature Reserve

reviews.text: One of the most beautiful trekking paths in Vietnam. Through 3 provinces: Lam Dong, Ninh Thuan, Binh Thuan. It’s worth to try once.

Amazing one of best place in Vietnam
Like 17years ago pure clean natural breathtaking next few weeks come back for 3days trek and survival trip

The typical scenery here includes pine forest, green meadows spreading over hills, and tiltled trails filled with basalt soil. Despite offering amazing landscapes, the trek is still a hidden gem and only known by some local adventure seekers.

The route is approximately 55 kilometers stretching over 3 provinces: from Ta Nang District of Lam Dong, through Ninh Thuan, to Phan Dung District of Binh Thuan. You will walk on high terrain, hills after hills, with the highest up to 1,100 meters above sea level and 500 meters at the lowest.
Wonderful place. If you like trekking, this is where you must visit.
Great view of hills and forests

data.formatted_address: X454+M44, Hòa Khương, Hòa Vang, Da Nang, Vietnam
data.name: Phuoc Nhon Hot Spring Resort

reviews.text: Friendly staff, service is good. But the best time is over for that hot spring. It feels like your entering an amusement park from decades ago. Most of the things are not working. Good part is it's quite. Not crowded. We as a couple booked the VIP packed and we had the whole place almost for ourselves. Only a few locale people were there. Because we were late the mud bath was already cold, not there offered is a new one in the public not VIP area. That was actually good because there was a berry view to the nature. Three sauna in VIP area was broken so we were relocated to the public sauna. Was not a problem, no-one there an the public sauna offered source to lay down. Actually a plus. The place needs renovation but it's worth the price and I think it's better then the new more expensive fake hot spring park which must be very crowded and noisy. If you're in a group of young people you may go there. If you want to have time alone and quite go to this place.
Quite good and cheap (80,000vnd/person), 02 big pool, friendly staff. They supply tower, short. The only thing is dirty bathroom and toilet.
Ok

We liked it very much. We arrived at 10 am, there was no one there at all. They started filling the baths for us and turned on the pool. It was great! The mud is the best of all that we visited in Vietnam!!! Probably, they are just taken and bred in other complexes. It's worth coming there for the dirt alone. The rest was so-so: the jacuzzi didn't work at all, but they filled it up and told us to get in there, sit and wait for the herbal bath. The food in the cafe is so-so. Herbal baths are also okay, you can try it once. They smell nice.

We decided to go in the mud, remembering the good mud in Nha Trang. We got there by taxi and it cost 260,000 dong. The driver could not find the entrance to this establishment for a long time. Entrance 500,000 for two, includes a mud bath (30 minutes) and a mineral bath plus a sauna (20 minutes). The place itself is in disrepair. The mud is not bad, the water is not bad, and everything else.... If you can visit for a long time, if you have few days in Da Nang, then it’s not worth it.

data.formatted_address: Duy Phú, Duy Xuyên District, Quảng Nam, Vietnam
data.name: My Son Sanctuary

reviews.text:
Had a great day here well worth the drive out,
make sure you catch one of the dances there as they put them on every hour or so.
It was blistering hot when we went so take plenty of water with you if not there is plenty of places to buy it too if you don’t mind spending.
I would suggest doing/booking a tour though as it’s a lot nicer and you’ll get a lot more history out of it.
But yes loved it

Son Sanctuary is a stunning location enriched by its archaeological significance. Contributions from multiple countries have uncovered fascinating artifacts, making it a cultural treasure. The serene environment and historical depth offer a unique experience, blending natural beauty with a profound sense of history. A must-visit for history enthusiasts.

It’s a sanctuary, but I enjoyed it as much for the nature preserve and the quiet magnificence of the lagoons and lotus flower fields with their lily pads. The price is 150 VND, very reasonable, and I suggest you get there early (we did at 0630), and head to the farthest point. You’ll catch a shuttle to the entrance of the walk, and you can go LEFT or RIGHT. We went right, enjoyed the ponds, then at the end came around the other direction. The ruins are interesting but not as well preserved as others, as much by age, as by war remnant.

Breathtaking beauty. Would honestly say a good 3 hours are needed to truly get an in depth feel for the history and culture. There was a dance performance as well and it’s nice to chill with a coffee at one of the little shops they have. Meeting people from all over was very fun too.

Impressive history but not so much left of it. The explanation metal signs are 'faded' and almost impossible to read.
It was a very hot day, but there are many shaded areas and lovely atmosphere. The dance show is cute.

reviews.text:

I'm not joking, it's huge, and completely empty. I'm sure they intend to fill it with many things, but at present, it's filled with emptiness.
good
Wonderful but crowded
The interior is quite pretty even if there is nothing to see. On the other hand, the funicular to go up all the park is very practical!
It was sunny and blue in the morning. After having lunch here, it started to rain☔️! Different weather and different scenery are worth appreciating😊

data.formatted_address: XXVR+6M7, Hoà Phú, Hòa Vang, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Lunar castle

reviews.text:
Lunar Castle is another attraction on the Ba Na Hills which is on the other side of the French village and you have to walk a lot to reach here.
The castle is a masterpiece in architecture and engineering as it looks like a fairytale kinda structure which you might have seen in the Harry Potter series or Disney Land.
There is no extra entry ticket to this place. Inside the castle, there is nothing great apart from some games where you have to pay extra and play, half of the restaurants inside were closed or there was hardly anything to eat. You can smell it is half-constructed or not fully operated once you are inside.
Apart from the photogenic structure, I didn't find anything great here to see.

Majestic construction of a castle. Very scenic sight and there is a meeting mini clock show every hour where the clock chimes and robotic bird comes out. Within the castle there is a 4D experience ride and some festival games. One of the attractions at Ba Na Hills that closest earliest so sure to visit this attraction before it closes at 5pm.

This is a castle inside French Village. It has two 3D/4D theatres which are really good for both kids and adults. They also have many  washrooms. There's also a train that connects this castle and fantasy park in French village. So you can take the train from here, if you don't want to walk all the way back to French village.
The 4d movie is worth watching especially in the rain.
Feel like you live in a dream place. Blue sky amazing castle

reviews.text: For the price I have absolutely no complaints. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The cleaner works very hard. The owner of the hotel went above and beyond for us. reviews.text: I dont know how to talk ‘bout this place!! Thats awesome, the staff and korean boss is really friendly.  Everythin’ is already be ready for us. Food, coffee, BBQ party pool...!!! I’m perfectly satisfied!

The staff managing the accommodation were friendly and helpful. However, the accommodation is very old and the facilities are not maintained at all. The dog next door barks all night, the bathroom is full of mold, the air conditioner is dripping water, and the water is like that of an old Korean inn. Compared to the pictures of the villa I saw, the actual space is more beautiful, spacious, and comfortable. Complete, the back yard is a swimming pool, the garden can hold parties, the staff welcomes and serves enthusiastically. I am very satisfied with the quality of service, price as well as the welcoming and service attitude of the staff. Large room, airy space, can comfortably hold a party with a group of friends or family!!!
I am very satisfied with the service here, the villa space is spacious, clean, airy, and has a delicious cafe. Staff and owner enthusiastically welcome!!!

reviews.text: Nice Instagramable garden near the golden hands bridge. A ballerina sculpture in the center is the highlight. A wine cellar nearby is worth going to as well

This colorful garden is the perfect spot to enjoy with your group, offering fresh air and a lush, green vista everywhere you look.
It's so inviting, you may find it hard to leave. The only drawback is that the food stores here can be a bit pricey. Overall, it's an amazing experience.

Tulips garden at Ba Na Hill. I visit during Feb 2023. The tulips is very beautiful.  The center garden is with a ballet statue with flowers. Garden is very large. Many people will visit this place for photos. Recommend to plan your visit during weekdays with less crowd.

The Le Jardin D'amour comprises 9 theme flower gardens: Suoi Mo Garden, The Secret Garden, The Garden of Eden, Garden of Contemplation, Garden of Memories, The Lovebird Garden, Scared Garden, Mythical Garden and The Vineyard. Each garden is unique and good for photo shoot - and that was most people were doing.

It's a garden well maintain just below the clouds (as I call it). Most beautiful sight one could get 1400m above the sea level. Gives a feeling of paradise.
The heart warming view you get from the hill top gives a  mesmerising feeling.

data.formatted_address: 96 Võ Nguyên Giáp, Mân Thái, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng 550000, Vietnam
data.name: Hilton Garden Inn Da Nang

reviews.text:
This Hilton Garden Inn provides an amazing view and access to the beach; however, the quality of the hotel doesn't live up to Hilton standards.

The best part of this hotel is of course the view. You have a great view of the beach and the surrounding area. You can walk to the beach in just a few minutes. It is inconvenient that the hotel does not provide any beach towel or place to rinse the sand off your feet before entering the hotel though.

The weightroom, while small, also has an amazing view. It's nice to workout with a view of the ocean. However, it's a bit strange that it is placed above the restaurant where people can hear sounds from the weights while dining.

The cheap price also attracts clientele that treat the public spaces like their home. For example laying down in the lobby with their shoes off, using the gym with no shirt on, smoking at the pool, etc. While the hotel can only do so much about this, it's something to consider before booking here.

I’m staying in room 2309 from July 18 to July 20, 2024. There is bias against Vietnamese people here. When I check in, usually at 4-5 star international hotels there will be a lobby boy bringing luggage to the room, but for me there was none. Breakfast at a restaurant that only welcomes foreigners, but not Vietnamese people like me. While talking on the phone, before I could finish my sentence, the phone operator turned off the phone. These are basic issues in the hotel and restaurant industry. Suggest the hotel management make better adjustments. I prefer the Marriott hotel system. Next time I will not choose this hotel again.

2024-6-19 to 2024-6-21
We stayed for 2 nights in a row. When we made the reservation, we saw a room type of the same price range. There was an accessible double bed room with a larger space. Unexpectedly, we ended up in a room with a very strong urine smell. Even the pillows were full of urine smell. I had to endure it all night and asked to change rooms the next day.
The service staff did not explain why the room smelled bad. They just asked us to take our luggage down and then we went out to play. When we came back, we were told the rearranged room number.
The infinity pool on the top floor is very small, so when there are already people in the pool, we don't want to get into the water at all. When we want to take a rest on the leisure chairs by the pool, the side tables of the leisure chairs are full of plates with leftover food. , no one came to take care of it for a long time, so we had to retreat and go downstairs.
Originally, I was full of expectations for the Hilton brand, but it turned out to be a terrifying experience that I least wanted to have on this trip.

I was looking for a bar because I was very thirsty and I politely asked reception and they guided me to the rooftop bar and I had a lovely time and service even as an external guest. They were even more surprised when they found out that I was actually a member of the Hilton rewards programme. Really great service and reasonable price. Thanks for kindly allowing us to use the pool and showering facilities alongside our drinks. Would recommend.

This hotel has it all. Great beach front location,  quiet end of the strip, yet close enough to get quickly to town. From check in to check out everyone was super friendly. Dang and Hieu at breakfast took super care of us and the assistant chef even came over to chat with us asking how we enjoyed breakfast. Great variety for breakfast with a super friendly egg station lady.
The pool view is to die for. The infinity pool is on the 27th floor with a great music mix sound track playing and ample chairs to relax in.
We did self laundry here which costs $5 US, but they give you soap and softener.  The washer and dryer were large so it only took one load.
The room was very large (we got upgraded with status) and the balcony had a great view of the beach and Lady Buddha.
I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat. One of the best Hilton brand properties I've ever stayed at!

data.formatted_address: 37V2+9GJ, Hoàng Sa, Thọ Quang, Sơn Trà, Đà Nẵng, Vietnam
data.name: Nhà Trưng bày Hoàng Sa

reviews.text: The curator is pretty and very good. Though i couldnt fully understand her, i could notice and feel that she really loves what she's doing and she's really awesome! I could feel her dedication. Also, the lady in black was so nice to us also. Even their kids talked to my son, unlike the others. Thank you very much. We've had a very good experience with you guys and learned a lot.
Really interesting history to read and see - the maps are really great   AND IT WAS FREE
Here I learned a little more about the history of Vietnam.  Thanks to the organizers for the exhibition!  The visit is free.

Free museum about the Paracel Islands and the dispute over them with China. It's free and there was none, the musem displays some pictures and documents about the islands throught history.
It's intesting because China's imperialistic regime is something we should know about. However, the museum is pretty small, just about the Paracel islands and a bit far from other points of interests. I wouldn't say it's a must see but if you are nearby then you might consider visiting it.

This little known museum is dedicated to the Parcel & Spratly island groups. These were taken from Vietnam in 1974 unlawfully by the Chinese. Invaded and still occupied today !
The museum documents and shows from history that spans a few hundred years, detailing that the islands were NEVER sovereign to China. As we know China today are building military installations. There have been countless maritime incidents. The fishing boat that is outside the museum was hit by a larger Chinese freight vessel and sank. The boat was lifted out the water and now stands as a reference to the ongoing dilomatic argument between China and Vietnam.
The museum is free and it is well worth a visit.
I loved it for its historical accuracy and the little known dispute of these islands.
